ztSmz0gchWTq6AphKwdWrA.text: Service was good, the food came out quickly. The food was mediocre. The omlette came out with the look of scrambled eggs, the busciuts and  gravy had little to no flavor and my hash browns tasted like dead potatoes.   This is a place to go maybe if you live really close or have some sort of emotional connection. I personally prefer other breakfast diners.

I2wp5GRC9o3PFEejaCZSpw.text: got some takeout breakfast was great called it in drove over parking was plentiful  they still take cash ,drove home was great pancakes and Denver omelets  chicken fried steak ,we will be back

oAoXwhBvC42bD7NvRR7JcA.text: I wanted to like this place, but I didn't and neither did my fiance.   Our food was not good. He ordered the corn beef hash. The corned beef had no flavor, the gravy tasted like flour, the biscuit was chewy. I ordered the number two. My eggs were cooked as I ordered them, and the pancakes were decent. But my bacon was another failure. I like it extra crispy. I ordered it that way too. It came out not crispy at all. After spending a few minutes attempting to flag down our waitress, she took it back. They cooked it some more, and it looked crispy. But it was still not crispy, which is a sign of bad/cheap bacon. Their sausage was also not good.  To make it worse, my food was either cold or lukewarm.   We got prompt service - the drinks and food came quickly. But once that happened, we were ignored. Water glasses were empty and remained that way. Coffee not refilled.   Also the staff seemed very inexperienced. We were sitting near the computer, and it was clear that the staff didn't know who was taking what table.  The servers also didn't know what table food was assigned to.   Their prices were too high and we did not care for the food or service, so we will not be returning here.

DLQTtnnzDShQfKBAmdMylA.text: This is our go to breakfast spot for so many reasons great food, friendly staff, relaxed atmosphere they have tables and a counter. Their homemade jellies are delicious and you must try their breakfast potatoes. Great customer service!!

xv5hp_qbkC5iKpAFVrjVKg.text: You can eat breakfast for breakfast. You can eat breakfast for lunch. You can eat breakfast in between and call it brunch. Regardless of when you eat it, I would suggest you eat it at Joe's diner!  They may have moved locations, but you still can't beat their breakfast sandwich!  I have never had anything that I could say was bad at Joe's.  I once said that I could close my eyes and point at the menu and end up with something yummy.  I am still pretty sure that holds True.  Portions are large and probably not the healthiest but if you are going to splurge on breakfast, you might as well have one of their fabulous buttermilk pancakes, or biscuits and gravy (which you can have with spicy chorizo if you choose), or one of their combos, or that breakfast sandwich that I literally dream of...  like I said close your eyes and point.  You won't be disappointed.

kSTNuYnAx90oaNOCRbHlMg.text: Drove by the diner the other day and noticed it replaced the Chinese buffet.   I was stoked so today the hubby and I went there for a Sunday morning breakfast; something we used to do a lot when we were first married.  We got there right before 10 and had no problem parking and were seated right away.  The owner was our waitress and the staff was friendly.  We gad some delicious Arbuckle's coffee which was hot too!  Love they had Sweet N' Lo too.  The hubby had the Western Omelet which came HUGE with a generous side of seasoned home fries and toast or buscuit.  He had whole wheat toast and enjoyed the homemade apple butter as well.  I had 2 eggs over easy (perfect ) which came with the same huge side of home fries and toast or biscuit.   I had the toast and homemade blueberry jam which was FANTASTIC! So glad we went and tried this great local breakfast place and we will be back!

VLVAvzeGmTyGMZFtedes1Q.text: I give Joes a two star only because I'm not crazy about the service. The elders in my family love joes. As do I for their food, which is consistently very delicious. However, every time I come in the wait time to be seated is a little long (that's important because I always have seniors with me). One visit we were told to seat ourselves and after five minutes asked to move because the section we sat in by the entrance was closed. The atmosphere is classic American comfort, yet the staff does not match the setting. It makes for a bit of a tense and uncomfortable mood. I know it could be overworked staff or low pay so I tend to give restaurant employees the benefit of the doubt. I will continue to come to joes but if the service stays the same I will convince my family it's time to choose a new diner

ZoPPolqF_CDFoDJUmuoqdg.text: ugly, poorly lit, microwave quality breakfast. id rather have a hungry man TV dinner. instant hershey squirts. so not worth it

jnwoESr2HADjpQMgFpcMsA.text: It's sad that a few other people review this diner so harshly. Joe has a heart of gold. This is scratch cooking. Not fancy but pure whole food done diner style. His fresh buttermilk pancakes are the best pancakes I've ever had. The hostess is lovely. She's autistic and Joe has given her a wonderful opportunity for her to learn, grow and work. There should be more community restaurants like this with people who care but aren't caught up in anything but good food, great values and good people. Thank you Joe. Your restaurant is a Phoenix institution and will be for years to come!  Go get yourself some pancakes!

aQgKj86i4W_E4aeikBdoZw.text: The move may have improved the experience.  Food was like home cooking and service was very good.    Ordered the wrap and it was enough for two meals, very generous on portions.

xZkIhb-lauDKNZHfT7AaIA.text: Best pancakes, sorry Matt's big Breakfast, it's True.  Good breakfast choices, local ingredients and Melrose Small Business makes it a hit.  They have Cholula & a special California, chili only sauce that is very tasty.  I only recommend they add Chilaquiles to the menu because I am selfish and I love Chilaquies or Southwestern style Migas.  Give this place a shot, the new location on 7th Ave. makes it a bit more convenient and the food is good.

TexdTrgKW65vsKNn9Y_-og.text: This little place is right in my neighborhood and I've eaten there several times now!  I love breakfast at any time of the day and the long weekend allowed me to eat there twice .  I love their coffee, service, and the overall friendly vibe.  The homemade jam, chorizo gravy, and biscuits are all yummy. I am also a fan of the breakfast potatoes, a  side dish I usually don't get too excited about. The egg "guide" on the menu is entertaining and the food is consistently well prepared.  My dining companions tried the burgers and pronounced them delicious.  They came with a side of fried onions that were a yummy surprise---try them as a side instead of fries and add a chocolate shake for the ultimate diner experience.  These folks are integral part of the neighborhood and I'm glad to have them so close!

a2ID05i-aXAPIhjUGwZmnQ.text: Worst experience ever!!! I went in with a group 7 we were visiting from Texas. The food was Great but my egg whites were runny, i had ordered them over medium. I sent them back. To my amazement the owner Joe came to our table and berated me for doing so it was humiliating i felt like i was in the twilite zone!! He repeated this 2 more times just to rub it in. Finally i confronted him and was told that because my sister carried in a coffee cup from the hotel, that was why he was treating us so badly? It was the most insane experience I have ever sat through.

U6Chp78-fH8gw-32IWUdxg.text: Overall it's a pretty nice place. Good food and very nice people. It's a very positive environment and family friendly. I would give it a higher rating...but I can't get past the coffee. It seems a bit watered down. I really enjoy coffee with breakfast so it's hard for me to get around.  Otherwise, good food and good people. Much attention is paid to the customer and they do care that people leave satisfied. For lunch I would especially recommend their burgers. Very tasty.

znRSjNnv5QBMxQ2cwHwKYA.text: New Paint doesn't help the food...  I really wanted to like this place. It just moved to right near where I live and I was hoping the food got better with the move. I have twice now gone there and ordered a veggie omelette and asked them to add ham to it. Twice now they have just given me a Denver omelette. On top of that the food has no cooked in flavor it is pretty bland despite having all the ingredients that should make it tasty.

Tdct8TLEiYQLDZ1-eqc73A.text: Great prices, friendly service, and a good selection of breakfast items. Their Chorizo items are really good and they even have Chorizo Biscuits and Gravy - yum. Their pancakes and omelets are good too.

VUQ3n6hsOT6PVTnGJkjqrw.text: Food was great, chorizo and eggs excellent as was the service. It's a relaxed atmosphere with a mix of customers. I will definitely go back.

T7W92LAojfVuG-PHDaQdkA.text: The food was solid! No-frills, straight up homemade diner fare. My breakfast burrito was excellent, but what made this place really enjoyable was the service. The owners were working; they introduced themselves and made us feel right at home. This is the kind of local business I love to support, and I'll definitely be back!

22Jlb9k_GCi4HY_R7QZOHg.text: Friendly customer service with Joe himself making his meet and greet rounds while working. Impressive. Tasty food. Well done Joe.

T8OQFguQRRVc2-QdF7wXfg.text: We tried this place for breakfast this past weekend because we had heard about it from several people.  It was pretty good.  We only had to wait five minutes for a table on a Sunday morning, which was not bad at all. The service was great the entire time. Always had our water and coffee glasses full.  The food was just okay.  We had their Eggs Benedict, I was not a fan of the ham, but the rest was pretty good. Their breakfast burrito was alright, just too many potatoes, which made it really dry. Their biscuits were delicious, but the chorizo gravy was just okay.

HJGzHyycyEFAQsmc7hnAVQ.text: Hostess not welcoming, staff running around trying to fix Order mix-ups, computer problems, orders delayed, etc. Joe, the owner runs around the place with his hair on fire making things worse. Really off-putting. Food is pretty good though. Definitely a frustrating and tense breakfast place.

PLvmDNjDB5Q8WGHhK69xmg.text: This place has good food but great service. They where definitely on top of things and the place was packed, it's refreshing to see someplace that tries hard in central Phoenix. Will be going back for the biscuits and gravy. The scrambled eggs where super yummy too! It would be nice if they had hash browns but, I guess you can't get everything. Enjoy this place for the middle class diner it is.

zhrQweg9abY12vbX-W7ENA.text: Best found local greasy spoon! We always end up at Joe's! Huge portions of good food. The chorizo sausage gravy is craveable. I get it as a side to just eggs! Never had bad service. I love how the owner will come by and check on you. And he hired folks with developmental disabilities and that warms my heart! Giving back!

OWK2xv2mr99tvz8MSbl0DA.text: I love this place!  Delicious food, huge portions and great prices.

HFiaQSgMVT4NExs4Bjv6EA.text: This is one of my favorite hangs when I have ahnklering for plain simple good food- The PANCAKES and WAFFLES are amazing.  The meatloaf is die for.  The owners have years of experience in food service and it shows.

HdiDgGveCdX5_Zl12ieXAQ.text: Joe's diner is your typical old school greasy spoon, and if that is what you are looking for it is very good. If you're looking for anywhere fancy or atmospheric, go elsewhere. But the food at Joe's is great, especially the breakfast potatoes and chorizo gravy.

xlxCS5Fn4PuqSEJ0ZgGh4Q.text: The best homemade breakfast in the neighborhood... I love coming here the wait is never long and the portions are huge.  I love their Country Fried steak and eggs and their chorizo gravy is amazing ...I always have great service every time we go. My husband gets the steak and eggs and the prices are great .

photos.caption: Photo of Joe's Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Amazing breakfast

J2DMRvbbo_X4z3EJQcQJaA.text: I went yesterday and the biscuits and gravy were awful the supposed homemade biscuits tasted like the ones from shamrock foods and the gravy was lukewarm and tasted like flour for the price i was seriously underwhelmed

2GeemQPeLXQZzwkePFW5xQ.text: We went to Joes for the first time yesterday morning.  We only had to wait a few minutes to be seated. I ordered the breakfast bowl and my wife had the number two breakfast with pancakes.    My breakfast bowl was mostly potatoes with very over done scrambled eggs on top.  My wife said her pancakes were ok but the eggs were tough and rubbery.  Our waitress while pleasant enough, took our order then disappeared.  We did not see her again until she brought our bill.  We had to ask a bus boy to refill our drinks.  All in all the food was not impressive and the service sub par. We won't be going back.

eiuNUnziTBDY1otydnuwHA.text: Joe's Diner was ok...I almost walked out because it smelled like eggs sitting in the trash or dishwater.  That grossed me out, but I was hungry and wanted to try a traditional breakfast.  The prices are reasonable and the food is good, not mouth watering, but solid food food.  The bacon was cooked perfectly.  Pancakes cooked perfectly.  Coffee was delicious.  Service was good.  Potatoes were good.  Honestly it's good food, but this place just smells.

photos.caption: Photo of Joe's Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. 9.99 plus I added potatoes and a toast.  Each was $1.99.  Two - three people can easily share the potatoes.  Good deal

Ia41RszJXMyyt7EqFK_RCQ.text: It's diner home style food. Friendly staff. Neighborhood feel. I enjoyed my corned beef hash and eggs.  The home made biscuit with sausage gravy is delicious! Good place to have breakfast after those late nights

5sVHS4HkJbl8K-UC_w85nQ.text: Joe's Diner is very aptly named. The owner, who sometimes comes out and visits with the customers, is named Joe, and it definitely serves diner food. We've been here three or four times, both as a couple and as a larger group. The servers do a good job keeping coffee cups filled and the food is tasty. I love the chorizo gravy and the chicken fried steak is very good. The various jams/jellies they offer are also delicious. This is a good place to go for an inexpensive, filling breakfast and also is a Yelp Cashback participant.

K8JkFtic40QJvlOa6coHkg.text: Service was quick, friendly and efficient as breakfast/lunch places should be. They did not disappoint in that aspect. I ordered the scramble, meat lovers and it was more than enough for one person! I probably could have split it with someone; I did end up taking half home. Mine was a little dry so I asked for a side of sour cream.  My sister ordered two eggs, potatoes and toast-hers was a little greasy for her liking so she soaked up some of the grease with napkins. Jason ordered the chorizo omelet, very tasty!  Good flavor.   One nice touch, the owner came around to every table and made people feel welcome and asked how their meals were.

photos.caption: Photo of Joe's Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bacon, ham and cheese scramble over potatoes

TZPTGr8pM6FFOp3aFJf8Sg.text: Well I haven't been here yet but if this is the place that plays Breakfast with the Beatles every Sunday morning then how could it be bad? Lol Rock on Joe see ya soon

b-y_qArLLUcooS4jDIOyrQ.text: The food was o . k .... Seems like the regulars get special treatment . And if this is the first time you came in , you are pretty much ignored . I had to remind my waitress about silver wear , my meal , my check . She never asked me if I needed anything . I am very easy to please . This is my first negative review I have ever written . This is a shame because I like to patronize my neighbor restaurants . I will not be back .

QT61T2P9ZIM6dQNyR_bLow.text: We were here for breakfast. I had Number One - ham, eggs, biscuits with sausage gravy (I opted for chorizo gravy). All tasted great. Service was good, fast. Atmosphere good in a family diner style.

photos.caption: Photo of Joe's Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Ham, eggs, biscuit with  chorizo gravy

A5hhJVjssuEPN5s-TQnuKA.text: The best pancakes I ever had. I am not a pancake afficionado, but these are airy and fluffly without being dense and doughy. The chorizo gravy and biscuit waa better than expected; I am not a biscuit and gravy person but theae were good, pretty sure someone who enjoys it would find them fantastic. My all time fav, corn beed hash was nice and crispy   Their coffee is amazing, not bitter, no gimmicks, just a great cup of Joe.  Read many reviews complained about the price. Not sure what other people are looking to pay for good quality of food. If a chain restaurant is more of your liking, avoid this place, you may be dissapointed about their menu selections and great flavors. I'm from NY, and paying $8.75 for corn beed hash is actually a bargain. Can not put a price on good comfort food and friendly service.

KXIkFqUpIUdtlKSSUxAXHA.text: Had the number 1 for breakfast. Sat at the counter because I was by myself. Was ignored for the most part because the waitress had to leave. Food tasted good but it would have been better hot. A bit pricey compared to other places I've been in Phoenix. Not as impressed as I would have thought given the crowd.

MSDjldr_1kUQBYcyV-AJEg.text: Visited on a Monday morning with a party of 8 people. The place was right off the road and canal, very convenient parking and we were seated right away.   Food: Delicious diner breakfast! Not too greasy and the plates were enough to share. The prices averaged $8-11am per person.   I will definitely visit again. Yummy!

HA2JqGP59q-Mv5yoeJBRMw.text: Not the most inviting space I've ever been to but the food hits the spot and made up for it.  This is a no frills attached diner type place for sure.  The food isn't going to be as fancy pants as you might find at some of the breakfast joints in the valley but that doesn't mean it isn't delicious!   Joe (I think?) was making the rounds and gave me some additional hot sauce that wasn't on the table (cholula/tabasco). I thought it was too vinegary personally but I appreciated the gesture and being referred to as "hot sauce guy" was amusing.  Of course, I finally came here the week before I'm moving farther/further(seriously which is it?) away.....I suppose I can suck it up and make the 7 minute drive.

hpIJpdW8PY_nQtYrLdLH1w.text: I had noticed this place a few times at it's old location and thought it was in an odd location. I drove by the current location and didn't realize it was the same restaurant until I looked it up online. The location is a much better one than the old one however they still have quite a bit to work on if they are going to make it over the long term. The Owner/Manager was waiting on tables and there seemed to be no managing of the restaurant. People were waiting to be seated or to cash out and no one seemed to be in charge just who ever was free. They seemed to have enough help, just poorly managed. The workers were all friendly and once we were seated we received prompt service. I noticed the Biscuits and Chorizo gravy and decided on the "Number 1" as they were included. My partner chose the Chicken Fried Steak which was covered with Sausage Gravy. The Chorizo Gravy had an ok flavor but the Sausage Gravy was much better. I was told that you could choose either and I would go with the Sausage if I ordered them again. Also, I thought the Chicken Fried Steak was a much better value as it came with Homefries, eggs and a biscuit for just a bit more. I noticed some other reviewers commented that the Ice Tea was not great. I ordered it knowing this and I agree. It was very weak and had an off taste. The Coffee was very good though. I understand the menu is limited (as are the hours) but maybe they will work through their Management issues and can expand both their hours and menu as I would love to see them make it and they have most of the parts to make a successful go. I will certainly be back as the Country Fried Steak was very tasty and overall it is a good value. I suggest giving it a try and read your fellow Yelper's tips as many were spot on.

Ma7Rixa0Yb_kaexBAyZQ8A.text: This is pretty much a no-frills place. I guess at one time the theme of the '50's diner' was unexplored, but here we are in 2014, well past that point. The food was meh, too. Bacon was kind of flavorless and not worth the calories. Biscuit was kind of salty tasting. The pancakes were very good, though, and I'd go back and order them alone.

nYwpohm4QZoO7wEBAi7l3A.text: We had a late breakfast here. Eggs, fries, toast, pancakes, and bacon were all tried between the two of us and it was all cooked perfectly.  The service was great too - very friendly and welcoming. We will definitely be back.

hjuSjIBXxfYzn5MyEiFohg.text: This place is aptly named.  A diner.  Simple, delicious no pretension here. No kale, certified organic cage free, gluten free, peanut free, fair trade nonsense here. Just a great cuppa Joe, served piping hot in a mug with cream.  Yes real cream. Friendly cheerful service.  We had the corned beef hash with eggs and an egg white omelette, both served with a side of toast.  They even have containers with fresh strawberry jam!  No plastic packets of jams from Sysco here!  If you are looking for a hearty breakfast, properly prepared and cheerfully served without an ounce of pretension, this is the place for you. And best of all this place is locally owned and operated.

Z1b6NljjPBvmBN-HfswFvA.text: Great place for breakfast!  Joe and Joan have always personally stopped by to talk to us and make us feel welcome and the coffee is as good as it gets!  Some of our favorites are the pancakes, eggs, bacon and potatoes and of course the buttermilk biscuits and gravy.  Service is great too.  The former location on 16th St. was fun but this new one is definitely more roomy.  One other note is that we appreciate that they try and use local products (Arbuckle's coffee, Kalil and more) if possible.

oOL7nN5R3mQYTT3lkUpk3Q.text: When we first walked in we didn't know whether to wait to be seated or seat ourselves, being our first time there, so we just stood there.  We waited long enough to consider leaving and going somewhere else.  There were under 10 people in the restaurant and no one was up front to greet us.  Finally one of the employee's told us, from the back of the restaurant, that we could just sit anywhere we wanted.  We were given a high chair that had to be wiped off first before we could even use it.  The server wasn't very friendly, my husband asked how she was doing and she said nothing then said, "what would you like to drink?"  We both ordered the number 2--- two bacon, two sausage, two eggs and either home fries or two pancakes - we got the pancakes. We got our eggs scrambled with cheddar cheese added.  The star of the breakfast was for sure the bacon (nice and crispy) and the pancakes.  The eggs and sausage were good, but they were nothing to write home about,  just the everyday eggs and sausage.  For the little one, I got a scrambled egg and some buttered white toast.  The toast was nice and thick, perfectly toasted.  The cost for all three of us to eat with a $5.00 tip was around $32.00, not too bad and the food was good and the portions were  big, especially the pancakes.  The inside was a bit drab.  Considering it was a diner, I expected a more upbeat 1950's vibe with bright colors and some music, it did not deliver and the bathrooms were kinda scary and had a bad odor to them. They have been at this location for about 6 months now and I would like to recommend a sign for when customers first come in that says "seat yourself" to avoid confusion on what to do, spruce things up a bit to look more like a diner and work on de-funking those bathrooms! Overall, it was just o.k. I don't know if it left enough of an impression for us to think of when we are looking for somewhere to eat.

M_7oHok4k4HpQckHFsGs3Q.text: I never went to the old location, I really hope it was better than this. I went here on a Sunday afternoon and there was more staff the customers. Which is why I was perplexed when it took 5 mins for me just for attention at the counter. I order coffee and a number 2. The food was good but being from the Midwest I don't understand the hype. During my meal I was never asked how was it nor was my coffee refilled. After I was done eating it took another 10 mins for someone ( not my waitress) to clear my plate. It was another 5 mins I had to wave someone down to get my bill. I was given the wrong bill and told the lady its not mine and was promptly asked if I was sure. WTH!? Yes I know what I ate. She just said just pulled up my seat in the computer and that's what is was. I told her what I had and she went and got the correct one. I live in the neighborhood and like having them close by, but I will hold off another visit till the service is better.

rVrV1fD5HXxQntqgbK7-kQ.text: Bad coffee.  No excuse for breakfast place.  Weak and not hot.  Food was just okay and very pricey.

8nHWRpMxO3dag-nAzoZS4Q.text: We visited Joe's on Tuesday, July 7th at approximately 11:00am.  Wow!  Seriously...Way over priced and some of the food was terrible, not all.   First off, price. You can get almost the same amount of food and decent quality at the local chain for at least  a 1/3 less the cost.  Almost all the breakfast selections were near $10.00.  We like to support the local merchant, so this is a big part of why we decided to try Joe's.   I see that they have gotten pretty good rating here on Yelp, but our food was so bad I literally could not eat it. Two of the 6 of us ordered the corn beef hash and eggs.  The hash was seriously the consistency of runny oatmeal.  Hidden under the over medium eggs.  I can eat just about anything.  I literally could not gag this down.  When I called the server over she immediately agreed.  I said I would have the same as the person sitting across the table form me, the other person who ordered said she would pass on another choice, lost her appetite. So I waited and waited and finally my meal came out.  They did take the corn beef hash and eggs off our ticket, but the added the meal that was my second choice, for $2.00 more.  So not only was my first meal absolutely awful, my second meal that I had to wait for cost me $2.00 more than I planned on spending.  Not good customer relations in my opinion.  We will be hard pressed to visit again.  Only giving 2 stars because the pancakes were good.

VU29S5cjC7arSiBWYzqJXw.text: Amazing food and friendly staff!! Definitely difficult to order because everything is so good it's always hard to choose. Best chicken fried steak!!

3NWYxaP1y1R8N-Itl8YfUw.text: Really good breakfast best I've had in a long time Joan was really nice she's also the owner and excellent prices

j_CODMAw6vNtEQDb97POtA.text: Update for September 2017: We tried Joe's again thinking our first attempt was maybe a fluke. It was even worse this time. The food was so bad, I barely ate any of mine and the waitress never bothered to ask if everything was okay.  Original review for July 2017: We just moved to the area and came here for breakfast on 4th of July, hoping to find our new go-to breakfast spot. Unfortunately, this isn't it.  I'm not sure if they forgot about the holiday or just weren't anticipating that amount of customers, but it was busy and they were understaffed. Despite that, our waitress was very sweet and really on top of her game. She keep our coffees (which were excellent) and waters full and noticed when we didn't receive our toast. Excellent service: 5/5.  Although they serve large portions, the food was just okay. Biscuit was dry. Pork chops were low quality and over-cooked. Overpriced for the quality. Food: 2/5.

5IMuHzQ2idknWiFGz-KRAg.text: Simply the best. Can't find better service or breakfast in the valley. Always a pleasure to dine here. Yes, it is a basic simple breakfast but it taste like quality at half the price. This is one spot where the whole family can eat out and not break the bank. I'm stuffed and full with money still in my pockets.   I highly recommend if you like fresh, warm pancakes you will love Joe's. Trust the True pancake critic.

photos.caption: Photo of Joe's Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Table for a family

vRkm9Bweh9Drbdw_KabE2g.text: Reading the negative reviews, I have to wonder if they are written by a competing restaurant owner because they are so completely inaccurate. The service was fast, the staff friendly, and the food delicious. I had the Number One - Ham Steak, Egg, Biscuits and Gravy. The ham was lean and tasty, the egg cooked perfectly, and the biscuits and gravy perfect and flavorful. My son had delicious French Toast. My other son ordered hash browns and the waitress pointed out they are breakfast potatoes, just to be sure we wouldn't be disappointed, and we weren't - the potatoes were so good everyone at the table raved about them.   I don't know how I have lived here this long an never been to Joe's, but we will be back for sure!

Kur_wix8yi1DO9OaLO0sFQ.text: Had breakfast here after an early morning flight.  It's not fancy but the waitress was nice and the food was good too.  Had an omelette and some pancakes.  Omelette was what you would expect but the pancakes were really good!

4HDwa-O0eHyQVxebo_nk1g.text: Ummm yeahhhhhhh..... I don't know about this place. My food look so sad.... I was sad to even eat it. My pancakes was so soggy. My hash browns was over cooked.. my potatoes were so soft.. *sad face* no taste at all.. And the lady was in a rush to get my mom and I out. Asked for napkins, she have me 2 napkins...   I will not be coming out.

1-QusLyJfAX4bRfxQKkHnA.text: Great breakfast place. Food was delicious. Server was attentive. The only problem is it's took awhile for the food to arrive, but after eating it we all agreed that it was worth the wait. Biscuit and chorizo gravy was out of this world. Definitely will be back.

icqTny1-c5qhiqRBg-S5RA.text: Went by this place for a bite and I was really impressed. The owner, Joe personally came to my table to see how things were. I offer him a seat for minute just to talk and he obliged.   The menu had a great array of breakfast items and the place was busy... always a good sign. The food came in large portions but not too much that it lost any class, flavor or appeal. Tasty and hot. My glass was always filled and I really appreciated the time there eating.   Lots of parking and I wasn't rushed at all.  It was clean and it was busy yet I really enjoyed a great breakfast  Joe was a great guy and I am going to return again soon as I'm done with this review... well as soon as my radiator is replaced right now... then I'm going.  Why five and not four stars? Are they perfect? No they aren't however it was a great breakfast on a day I wasn't felling well and that I felt good afterwards it was clean, although busy not too loud at all. I was recognized as a person not a paycheck as I felt I should be treated and joe the owner took tine from other guests orders to sit and talk with me although he wa short staffed and talking orders himself. I felt respected there and I left wanting to just sleep the day away I was so full of good food

Zp4ZeTtddUOAQTWd_aUqYw.text: It's the breakfast potatoes! They'll hook you with the breakfast potatoes.   Beyond that, the family-style hospitality and consistent performance in the kitchen have secured Joe's a spot on our "where should we go for breakfast?" response card.

vG9iKQ7GNDeTWbMZokDPiQ.text: This place was great! I was visiting Phoenix and had no idea where to eat breakfast by myself on a Sunday morning. After reading a few Yelp reviews I chose this place, and I was very happy I did.   Very friendly service from both the hostess and server. This place has that old diner feel which I really like. It was very clean inside. It wasn't overly crowded either. And there is even a counter you can sit at if your by yourself.   My food came out and everything was so tasty! I got a waffle, eggs, bacon and sausage. All the food was of decent quality and prepared perfectly.   Plenty of parking in the private lot is available.   On my next trip to Phoenix I wont think of eating breakfast anywhere else but Joe's.

Ikr7ahP4fdrIMfUOVsL40w.text: My friends and I have been here a couple of times and it has always been pretty good. Today, not so much.  Sat down and got our drinks, ordered our food. 40 minutes later, our waitress keeps saying our food will be right up.  Then, the table next to us, arrived after us received their meal first!  Then we asked our waitress about our food, " Oh, they are just starting to make it now". Are you kidding me?  Needless to say, 50 minutes of wasting my time. We walked out and you lost my business for good.

1zb-fXvIdqq9nVHUuAZVRw.text: We live across the street from Joe's Diner, and never got a chance to go because it's only open 7-2. The diner seems to be one of those places that has been around for a good long while and the Clientele all looked to be regulars. I ordered the pancakes, and there's something about them that makes me nod my head agreeably. They're more on the hearty side than sweet, and you don't even need to douse it in syrup to appreciate them. They stand alone and are good even with just butter. The rest of the food was standard diner food. I can't say I love the place, I don't think it was my vibe, but I can see why they have regulars, and I respect that. They're a plain-jane type of diner that delivers the staples of breakfast food just fine.

photos.caption: Photo of Joe's Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Solid pancakes, nothing fancy but sometimes simplicity takes the cake!

63nmrXcSagTDbsbzpbXPdQ.text: 5/5 for pricing as the deals and single item options had great pricing. Options for $10 and under even a few $5 or less side items for light eating. 5/5 for food as the quality of food was beyond what I expected from a small diner in Phoenix (came for the weekend from California) and was impressed by the variety of food options and the actual quality of the food that was served was better than expected but the one negative was the speed of the delivery which impacts the next grade on service. 3/5 on service unfortunately. The waitress was attentive to getting me refills so I'm grateful for that but the food took a long time to be served. I understand that it's a small diner and that food is cooked to order but it probably took 20-30 minutes from ordering for the eggs, pancakes, sausage, bacon(2,2,2,2)and the waitress didn't  really converse with us  or smile much but those small things can be overlooked. A good spot to check out if your in town

UB6SOjm_Ku5mkbAPqvpRVw.text: Here are just a few reasons I love Joe's:  1) It's locally owned, the owners are always here and super nice.  2) They have the ideal diner coffee. You know? Like endless hot coffee that's really smooth and mellow? They even sell the coffee they use and I think I need to buy some next time.  3) The corned beef hash. This is not something that jumps out at me on a menu, but it is excellent! Super crunchy and covered in three eggs. My favorite breakfast entree. 4) Chorizo gravy. This is Arizona. Eat some chorizo gravy.  5) The pancakes. These are soooo buttery. I don't want to know how much butter is in there, just let me be happy. Eat at Joe's!

TGgxxIL0MvOXar0DDP3OOw.text: Excellent food. Cooked my eggs correctly the FIRST time. Pancakes...awesome. Biscuits with Chorizo Gravy...awesome. Prices were fair. Would like to see a few more options but hey, that they have is working.  Service was excellent. Both waitress in duty this morning were very nice and pleasant but not over the top.  You have to try this place.

photos.caption: Photo of Joe's Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pancakes. Biscuits and chorizo gravy. 2 eggs and toast. Fantastic meal.

dv1gkGei1pAygzVArIjNZw.text: Classic diner. Owner/chef Joe is a real pro. Excellent flavors. Try his gravy. Bacon nice and thick and always cooked right. Simple food done right. Cheerful staff rounds out solid breakfast. Highly recommend

Pn2N3AiZEitfIj88XLKOTw.text: Ordered eggs poachedhard, every place I go they do it,  Dennys, Cracker  Barrel, etc. They brought eggs out soft I asked if they could be cooked more because  I asked for them hard, no I could have boiled eggs. They had the Grey around the yolk and taste different, not what I wanted, didn't  eat yolk. Seriously,  every place else can handle ut!  2 stars because they were playing  Christmas  music!  The bacon, chorizo gravy and eggs  were good, spicy!  Selection  of tea when you get hot tea.  I  won't  go back, too many other choices.when I spoke to the female owner /wsitress/cashier about the eggs, how the boiled eggs were different,  not what I wanted, unappealing,  not as good, her reply was that they cook poached eggs 3 1/2 minutes  because that is the law...that is the minimum, but you can cook them more!!! I explained  that I get them that way every place I go and if places like Dennys ca get it right, there is no excuse for them or to.  It was like  talking to a brick wall. She didn't  care, so much for the customer being right!

photos.caption: Photo of Joe's Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chorizo gravy bisquits,  pancakes, eggs, bacon and sausage!

lfmtmOP3Aj9EHmvZyROhdQ.text: Excellent Food! Excellent Service! Thank you Joe's! Yum! I had the number two and my bro had the chorizo biscuits and gravy and Joe's did not disappoint! Love how they are so kind and personable. Joe and Joan (the owners) walked around and talked to all the guests at their tables and checked in to make sure everything was great... It was! Thanks again! This California Girl was not disappointed

Rb7DtKQGxC-42gWYnvUz7A.text: BEST PANCAKES EVER!!  This diner was such a treat! Everyone there was friendly and sassy! The pancakes were amazing, the house potatoes were perfectly seasoned! Veggie omelet was delicious! Even the coffee was good!   I found it by chance when an out of town guest was looking for a brunch spot on Saturday. So glad he found this place! I've been craving it again ever since!  The food, the atmosphere, everything was just what you'd expect at a diner! I want to become a regular!

ieRWf-u71CHwHjv5CCbYqQ.text: Locally owned business with all the standard diner fare, a few twists, and executed especially well.  I've been here at least a dozen times with my girlfriend who introduced me.  We drive out from Chandler past 700 other breakfast spots because she used to live in the area and the biscuits with chorizo gravy can't be beat (I've tried).  I don't mind because I always have a good experience.  Joe and Joan are the owners and really care about making sure the guest are happy.  Joe can always be seen making his rounds talking to people and more often than not Joan is serving tables herself.    This past weekend I tried the corned beef hash and my girl ordered the biscuits and chorizo gravy with a side of bacon.  I think we waited about 5 minutes before Joan who was serving us stopped by to let us know that we were going to be waiting a few extra minutes for some biscuits to come out of the oven.  We didn't really mind and the food was great as always.  The corned beef hash was perfectly crispy and the yolk in the eggs over easy were just right.  They were happy to let me substitute toast as a side, and the bacon is always on point.  When we were ready to pay the bill Joan let us know that she was comping that tab since we had to wait, which I assured her was unnecessary but she insisted.    I felt extra bad because I didn't have any cash to tip but our next stop was the Arizona Animal Welfare League and SPCA where I felt compelled to pay Joan's courtesy forward and donate the 25ish bucks I would have spent on breakfast and her tip to the charity in their name.    Sorry I didn't have cash to tip you Joan, but hopefully you know that the positive energy you and your husband put out to your customers and into your food is appreciated. We'll be back!

26v4IqoJiYo41bKHJcjw7A.text: Joe knows pancakes!! Another great breakfast at Joe's. we have been there many times it is always solid food and friendly service.

qje_ADuJEEaDQnie3HaUJQ.text: Last breakfast was great. Good good and prompt service.  Love the breakfast bowl. With the side of chorizo gravy!

w77mUgLICQGOi7GWZhNyDA.text: Awful experience, immediately seated which was probably the best part of the experience.  Waitress took our order, but never actually placed it. Waited 45min for our food, owner didn't seem to care, never got one apology. Super disappointed will never return.

0U6_KT9DxJRBZ2hku5k02A.text: Great food! I love coming here for breakfast or an early lunch.  If your looking for good biscuits and gravy try the chorizo gravy.

R1eDjsERaCackPRobXxYQg.text: It was ok. Food was average and service was ok. Will go back sometime but won't make a special trip like I did the other day to try it.

SIcB1F_sBx3CP2B0Al6s7w.text: Great food, coffee, AND service! Every time I visit Phoenix I just have to visit Joe's Diner. I just love this place! The potatoes, pancakes and coffee are superb!! Yummy!

ehlYD3H8Rmkf7NpEOM0hVA.text: What a disappointment. Un-full glass of beer. Ordered a burger and onion rings. The lady who was expideting the food was so confused. There were 4 entrees and 3 salads waiting to be delivered. She kept looking a tickets and squinting seeming confused. She decided to deliver the cold salads before the hot entrees. My burger was a joke. The bun was mangled and part of it was missing. One piece of romaine lettuce that was 90% rib, a grim slice of tomato that was mostly white core and the size of a 50 cent piece and my fresh mozerella in a weird pile in the middle of the beef. Once probably warm and melty now a congealed blob. My waiter delivered a bottle of mustard and the most nasty bottle of ketchup ever, with dried spilled ketchup from some other diner, i didn't want to touch it. I asked for my onions rings, he left and came back and told me he forgot to order them. I passed on a re-order. The beef was tasty, but everthing else was way below par. This was a burger sale night, so maybe they don't care, but this was orginally priced at $12.99, burger only no sides. Not coming back here ever.

LcCykJORwKP0PQgwzaEOZQ.text: Excellent diner!   Fresh, delicious and reasonably priced food. I had the Number 2 breakfast and it's amazing.  Fluffy buttermilk pancakes and the best bacon ever!    Friendly and efficient staff.  Even met the owner and she's a delight.  If I lived closer, would make this a weekly thing.  Seriously.

vazH7w0fbQDAoXDnYYp3Uw.text: Smelled like cat urine, sad/unfriendly waitresses whom acted like I was inconveniencing them by eating there, and a hair in my food the second she set it down I noticed the hair and the waitress actually took my fork and proceeded to attempt to pick the hair off my egg. Disturbing. Not updated and slightly pricy for the below par food. Good coffee doe.

QcDOsRKH8vLEOYvwUbBPXg.text: I was about to review this restaurant praising them for how good it is and I hear the owner Joe talk to a couple of customers in the middle of the restaurant bad mouthing reviews from Yelp. I don't care what you think, Joe, but customers take a lifetime to acquire and a minute to lose them!!! You should be GREATFUL for every comment, your food can be made at home and easily purchased somewhere else. When we take a few seconds of our lives to write a review, it's because we want to help you succeed, pay attention to every review, read between the lines and your restaurant would be the best, not just good.  I like your food, that's why I'm giving you 2 stars, I was about to give 5 stars but you insulted me and every person that take the time to review your place, you have something going, don't ruin it by feeling you are too good to fail!

Zm0aZrI5hxh0CgSwsyvaEA.text: No wait on a Sunday morning. Moderately slow service that is disorganized, although they are friendly. The corned beef hash is mostly potatoes, easy on the beef. Oatmeal was divine. Chorizo gravy wasn't our favorite. It's a cute divey diner, support your local business.

qx7pkArdN2sH-okNmQmdBA.text: When I pulled in there was only about 4 cars in the parking lot. First be careful walking up to the door, the black out stuff over the door doesn't just block out the sun, it blocks out everything. My hand got rammed as I didn't see someone coming out. Don't you go in/out the same way you drive on the road in the USA? Well, she didn't get that memo.  Two young ladies greeted me and told me to sit anywhere. I sat and was quickly greeted by Amanda. She asked for my drink order, I really wanted coffee, and asked if she had FuFu coffee. I liked that she understood what I was asking for because I like the sweet/creamy/flavored coffee, but she said No, just regular coffee. So I got a soda.  When she came back with my drink I ordered the Chef's Special Corned Beef Hash. I wanted my yolk to be runny and asked if that was sunnyside up. She suggested the eggs to be flipped, I assumed it was the same thing so said yes. Not sure what happend, but one egg had some runniness, the other one was cooked through. The hash was well done and tasty. The biscuits and gravy was okay... the gravy had a few sausage pieces and when I say few, I really do mean 3 pieces. Its one biscuit and it was okay. I guess the meal as a whole was okay. Maybe my expectations were a bit high but I could have made a bit better biscuit & gravy with eggs how I wanted.  As I waited the diner quickly filled up with people. I noticed the lady who took my order was pointing out to the other waitresses, a bill was ready, a table to clear, a coffee cup needs filling, etc. As it got super busy I waited for awhile to get my check. Leaving the place I noticed that a majority of the spaces were filled, including the lot behind the building.  The atmosphere is casual, the tables will be changed out with advertisements from other business', so if weren't bombarded with ad's everywhere in your life, you'll be eating with more in your face.  Would I be back? Not sure....

uU7CArqcT0SCJ8t7BVACVA.text: I order the same thing every time.  Corned beef hash. I ask them every time I like my eggs over medium, hate runny whites.   Finally asked owner how come no one in your kitchen can cook an over medium egg? His response is it's impossible.  Really?  I can cook them and yet a diner owner says it's impossible.   Maybe he miss understood me but my wife was right there and she just looked at me in disbelief.  Also they rave about their biscuits and gravy and let me tell you they are average at best.

AKkIqLH5S0NAnQ-pYOWc6g.text: Went for a quick bite while waiting for my puppy at the vet.  -my wife ordered scrambled eggs with bacon and potatoes. The eggs appeared like the powdered eggs patients receive at the VA (tasted like them too). The bacon was barely warm. It was also dry as though it had been resting under a heat lamp. For the price, I expect fresh product rather than food that was clearly sitting out after being prepared.  I had a burger and fries. The fries were fair, however the burger was greasy and sloppy. The worst part was the bun which was also greasy, not crisp and was dense. Less than 20 minutes later as I write this review, my stomach already hurts.   On leaving, my wife stopped in the rest room. She reports that it looked like a bathroom from a carnival or truck stop.  Suffice it to say, I won't be returning. Overall, it was a greasy disgusting mess.

bO9KzEhlQFKXnM47EQDpqA.text: I love pancakes but really hate trying to make them at home.  With Joe's just a short bike ride up the road from me I'm probably going to forgo ever attempting on my own again. The pancakes are so good and even better as part of the #2 menu item.  Two pancakes, bacon, sausage and eggs prepped your way. It's a big tasty meal!   My friend ordered the biscuits and gravy and said he really liked them.  I think I've just discovered I really do not like country gravy. On the other hand, I really like turkey gravy on anything.

oWItuoyE1LqcuTp4a2nTbQ.text: My family and I were staying nearby while visiting family in Phoenix.  We had breakfast here 3 out of 5 days--the rest of the family eats eggs/meat, while I am vegan.  We were all very happy!  Everyone else said that the eggs were exceptionally fresh-tasting, and then spent the rest of the meal trying to figure out how 'fresh' tastes--apparently, it tastes great!  I was happy with toast and fruit, especially since there was homemade cherry and strawberry jam on the table.  Amazing.    Service was fast and very friendly, and prices were very reasonable for breakfast (about 7-10 per person; less for my fruit/toast).  The space was clean and seemed accessible if you use a wheelchair (large open space near tables at the front of the restaurant).  Thank you, Joe's!

kT6NzNdijJBz3CRc2DwREA.text: Literally the best pancakes ever. Not exaggerating. You may think the atmosphere is whatever but who cares. The pancakes make up for it. And they aren't overpriced. Nor are they pretentious hipster cakes. They're just plain old pancakes. Truly amazing. I love this restaurant.

BuPxgchdsI1k9mRjTH6kKw.text: Breakfast was very good. Fast friendly service.  Good help with menu recommendations.  Food was out in a flash, yet the eggs were obviously cooked fresh and my request for over easy was cooked properly.   As an ol country boy from TN, I have made the search for decent biscuits and gravy in Arizona a personal mission of over 7 years now.  These were good contenders. The gravy is primo.  The biscuits were good but not quite as outstanding as the gravy.  An extra minute or 2 too long in the oven can make a great biscuit reduce to good by making the bottom a little tough instead just firm.  Therfore, 95% of each biscuit was actually great as well.   Coffee was also excellent. I drink it black and I don't love $tarburnts.  If you like old school black coffee with coffee in your coffee, then Joe's has that ebony nectar your grandparents loved.    I will be coming back.

v3gDuctOkAvbAsNwvRawvA.text: Great job Joe! Breakfast was delicious and exactly how we ordered it! The little ones shared the breakfast bowl (they brought out two separate bowls so we didn't have to separate ourselves) eggs were cooked to perfection for my husband's breakfast, and my corned beef hash was outstanding!

photos.caption: Photo of Joe's Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. 3 basted eggs with a half order of biscuits and gravy!

FQC7KUHJbEHXGUXYnSQOpg.text: Great for what they are, an old fashioned breakfast and lunch diner. Homemade food from scratch, nothing fancy. Set your expectations correctly and you'll have a great meal and probably a conversation with Joe himself.

HbIDxX6ZlupRUy1NctKbdw.text: Looking for the best breakfast in the Valley of the Sun, without having to cook it  ourselves - we found  "Joe's Diner" We may never make breakfast again!   Perfect poached eggs, crispy bacon and pancakes Henry Winkler tweeted as the best pancakes ever are here.  There may be a line to be seated on weekends, be patient.   "Joe's Diner" at 4515 N 7th. Avenue, Phx AZ 85013, everything you need to start the day:)

ssNkhKkv8XMxZnMvDtjDhw.text: Aloha HAWAIIANs... I recently went to this Diner for breakfast. I wanted to experience Chorizo gravy biscuits, and I am glad I did. It was delicious and when I return home you can bet that the next time you come to my house you will be tasting this wonderful creation. If you are in Arizona stop here for the omelettes. I didn't care for the spices on the home  fries but to each his own. Double down on the Chorizo biscuits 'n gravy.

oe8GIS0QaewF71_MwSo7RQ.text: Amazing and savory. The service is like visiting family - you feel at home! Joan is always a treat to have serve you, and Joe always makes his rounds to check on your experience. Will always be a fan!!

ukkqZHglHjo3r8YYzh1s6Q.text: I absolutely love this place. We had an amazing  breakfast,  Joe is very nice, provides excellent customer service and knows what he is doing. Great food and great vibe.  Highly Recommend

FnvVZa8SrGDxfqOR_7Vz0w.text: So let me explain my 3 star!!!!  My daughter talked us into going her for her birthday breakfast because the biscuits and gravy was supposed to be the best!!!! Mmmmmmmmmm I was totally lied too by my own child!!! It was so so.. at best... biscuits were not fluffy nor fresh and the to die to sausage gravy needs to be rethought and redone. Also the omelette my wife ordered came with cheese when we spoke 2 times to waitress about NO CHEESE!! Somewhere this got lost I guess!!!  Coffee want Great either... I don't want to bag on this place anymore but surely this year I will spend time taking my daughter to bigger and better breakfast spots!!!!!

VTLXtKkiEbduYkjg87KdKw.text: We were looking for a new brunch place and stumbled upon Joe's diner. Everyone was friendly, including Joe. I had the border omelette and my wife had the breakfast bowl. We split the Belgian waffle for dessert. Everything was great, we will definitely be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Joe's Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Joe's Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of Joe's Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States

KcCZdKXTK9nFdERIZU0URw.text: Joe's Diner is a cute little family run business that offers home cooked style food. I ordered a meat omelet which came with a large side of potatoes and a pancake. Everything came from the kitchen quickly and tasted so fresh like a home cooked meal. Only downside is the diner is old and seems a little run down. I think for the price the atmosphere is fitting and everything was clean.

dWUMNVsm_ZivIHGwtQ11aA.text: My girlfriend and I just had breakfast here Wow The breakfast potatoes were to die for and the bacon was out of this world I even tipped the cook Nicely done!

HQLPV9r_aHzq7h_tGhAwRA.text: Great place for breakfast when out in Arizona. Best pancakes I've ever tasted. My wife found it when google-ing for a place to have a good breakfast not being an IHOP etc. great friendly service. Best pancakes in town as advertised! Will definitely be back next time we're out here in Arizona. Had to buy a shirt from this place also.

eZyGz1gfmPYsdOgjn493PA.text: Waaaay over priced for the food they are slinging.  I understand the rents are high in the melrose district but c'mon folks...  usually the staff is friendly but connie always seems like someone just kicked her dog or something - not a really friendly person. the only reason i go here is cause my wife likes the joint.

NdKZUSFs3PHMwHrDsz13cg.text: This place was very nice, good food, and that 50 no style dinner vibe is wonderful! Very good food, staff and service was good.

MLTa2ooIdDvCgzIbyd99Sg.text: This place is fantastic. The food and service is as good as any of the best spots in town. Inexplicably, Joe's doesn't have the wait of all those other places. We were seated within minutes of arrival. The food is basic diner fair... In fact, my mother asked me what kind of pancakes they had and the waitresss basically said "we have pancakes". Everything was so delicious. The menu even has an explanation for how to order your eggs. I love over medium, but went with basted (which is basically the same as over medium, but steamed instead of flipped). It was, hands down, the best cooked egg I've ever had!! Coffee is delicious.

Gvndaw4pKyzfGxBFkwUCnw.text: Joe's Diner is my absolute favorite diner! Everything about your experience at Joe's will warm your heart. The hot coffee, the warm breakfast, the friendly staff, the friendly customers. It's my favorite place to be on a Saturday morning. It's very underrated - you have to go try this place out. My go to order is their two egg special, eggs poached and a pancake on the side. Trying a pancake is a must, they're awesome!

2Vs5_-GYHUFAs7RuvjodwQ.text: My husband and I stopped in for breakfast. There was a sign directing people to seat themselves; we chose a booth by the window. Our waitress arrived and asked if we would like to get started with drinks first. We both ordered coffee and water. She returned after bringing our coffee and water to take our orders. i ordered the combination omelette with home fries and whole wheat toast. My husband ordered the corn beef hash served with three eggs over easy, and biscuits and gravy. Our food arrived after about 20 minutes: fresh and hot. Everything tasted wonderful, with the right amount of seasonings. I tasted my husband's biscuits and gravy--and the gravy was not overpowering--I could taste the sausage in it, and it had a nice blend of spices. The service and food is outstanding. The prices are reasonable because they feed you here--the portions are large, you shouldn't leave hungry. I like it when I can go into a restaurant and have excellent service along with delicious food. Its the best of both here at Joe's Diner.  We will return in the future.

photos.caption: Photo of Joe's Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Combination omelet with home fried potatoes and wheat toast.

OVs-uDjOrVVQPYgKBotG6Q.text: Went to a late breakfast here with my family on Saturday and were not impressed at all. Our waitress Carrie made you feel like an inconvenience for being there and she was not pleasent at all. When we sent back the waffle twice she was no where to be found. If it were not for Joe coming by our table and another waitress named Layla helping I would be rating one star. Joe is the owner and introduced us and made us feel very welcome. If this was based off of Joe and Layla alone I would be giving 5 stars! The pancakes were VERY good, the waffle was sent back twice till it finally came out crispy(thank you Joe and Layla for making sure we left happy). As a fellow server my advice is for Joe to get more severs like Layla and your reviews will be all 5 stars. Definitely asking for her if we end up coming back to try this little place again.

photos.caption: Photo of Joe's Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States

Hg__83UrHmnlxICgbtY1Qw.text: Ehhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhhh.  I was really hoping to find a local diner with delicious breakfast that I could go to with three of my best friend, my Seinfield diner if you will, but unfortunately, this just wasn't the case.   The inside is like a small Village Inn. very typical, very boring, and no pie.   Our server seemed extremely overwhelmed, even though it wasn't super busy (we came in for a late breakfast). She was pleasant, but nothing exceptional about the service. We ordered pretty basic breakfast items, and it took an exceptionally long time to get our food.  I ordered the number two, which had sausage, bacon, pancakes, and eggs, which is a lot of food. Unfortunately, it wasn't great. Both my pancakes and sausage had been burned. I was happy to have the bacon as a back up which thankfully, was cooked perfectly. The eggs were pretty basic, but I didn't have to make them so they were worth it. I stole a few potatoes from my boyfriend, and I will say, they definitely know how to make breakfast potatoes. this should 100% be your side choice.   The best part about this is they definitely don't skimp on the orange juice. I did get a giant glass of OJ which was ..orangey.   In my opinion, it was a little overpriced for the quality of the food, but you will definitely get a lot of food on your plate.

pBcRjWkgz21VceX-iY21Ig.text: Arbuckle's from the west coffee, the best.  Food and ambiance and staff are amazing, it is local serving Az .  Come in in & enjoy

5FbvdW7gRLV2IY-g2aIgAA.text: We had a positive experience our first time into Joe's Diner. They had a ton of parking, friendly hostess, and solid food. I tried the corn beef hash and it was just what I wanted. Great little gem and nice alternative to Melrose Kitchen or 5th Avenue Cafe

photos.caption: Photo of Joe's Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Breakfast combo sub pancake for French toast
