TIxdv1gjqfISv8zrdVWutw.text: One of the best places the eat breakfast! I love coming here , it's family owned and the food is always great ! I always get the omelets and Pancakes , they taste like homemade ones with fresh butter ! This place is a must!!!

VS_0VizdkoHhGZ576GyYsg.text: OK  I have lived here in the valley for about 10 years,  been on a search to find 'real' made from scratch sausage gravy and have finally found it!  great sausage gravy actually sausage/bacon gravy is fantastic BEST IN THE VALLEY !  Great Service super friendly staff....JOE even came over introduced himself and was very appreciative we were eating at his Diner.  I had the corned beef hash cook perfect and 3 eggs, biscuit and gravy  great meal.  I/We will return many many times  this is my breakfast spot now!  I hear the pancake are fantastic cant wait to go back.

vGVZtlbu0mLFXRLt3MaV2A.text: Fabulous!!!!!! Fresh good food!!!!!!! Best Corned Beef Hash!!!!!! Great service! Friendly staff!!!!!!! I just do  not know what these people are talking about. I live in the neighborhood and love this place.

6IVkEbjEzCz3QRi2rZ6itA.text: Enjoyed my breakfast and the device was excellent. Was honored to actually meet Joe. Happy to have you in the neighborhood.

YbnZYLhOAFAf7dvTHzCnmw.text: I could eat here every morning and never get tired of the food. The pancakes are to die for! I've never tasted anything like them. Joe is always in the store and is so much fun to chat with. Support your local business's!!

RW_kchycysO18rQLqPkDtA.text: Go to Joe's Diner if you want good food because they've got it. Especially breakfast, which is excellent. Everything I've tried at this place (and their original 16th St. location) has been great. It's not cuisine, it's diner food and it's done right.  On the other hand, if you also value good service with your delicious chow, forget this place. On previous visits, the service has often been spotty, but it's easy to cut them some slack because the food's good and, after all, it's a diner. This morning I spent an hour and ten minutes sitting at Joe's counter, with only about 20 minutes devoted to actual eating. And I never got a second cup of coffee.  After the folks sitting next to me -- who came in after I did -- received their food, I flagged down another employee to inquire. Apparently, the server failed to give my order to the kitchen. Eventually, my breakfast bowl arrived, hot, delicious and, maybe even worth the wait. The server mumbled an apology for its lateness but had to be asked to provide me with utensils.   About that coffee: The personable young woman who took my order was careful to explain that they were out of their special cups for decaf drinkers, so I should watch out in case someone tried to give me a refill with regular. Indeed, the VERY SAME SERVER came back to me later with regular coffee and tried to put it in my cup. As instructed, I stopped her and said I was drinking decaf. My cup remained empty and that was the last I saw of my server.   And this was the last time I'll visit Joe's. Great eats just aren't worth the aggravation of being ignored.

deHWIgA6gGEhJSSIFwo3RA.text: Good but not great. Chicken fried steak was a food supplier patty but the sausage gravy was home made and very tasty. Potatoes were under cooked but eggs were perfect. A $14 breakfast. They need to step it up and prepare everything fresh or take it off the menu. Going back to try the pancakes.

eIJZOIud53p2lsTHx8kh-w.text: This is quickly becoming my wife and I's favorite breakfast place. Great Bacon and Chorizo gravy. Also, everything seems to have a Joe's Diner twist too it, such as the homemade apple pie and jelly. Good coffee, service and atmosphere as well. We will be back... soon.

OSiQOct3_V-TFUJYnQ6JrA.text: We love Joe's for breakfast and lunch. Great service and terrific food. Very kid friendly which is a plus. The new location is spacious and nicely decorated. The pancakes are the best---love the syrup!!!  Keep up the great work Joe and staff. We'll see you soon.

7cCujk4niPr08nHlxf9_bg.text: Went to Joes this morning! First off after about 3 mins of sitting down i got to meet Joe and shake is hand! He is awesome and was sold on the place after that. I ordered the combo with two eggs, pancakes, sausage and bacon it was great! The wait staff is super courteous and attentive. Will be going back many times to this place!

Ey5rEOeBAvQYW2AwR_CuGQ.text: Eh. Stopped in hoping for a great breakfast experience. Eh. I was disappointed. Menu is a regular diner breakfast menu standard fare. Service was fairly speedy but my food was cold.  Try it you might enjoy it more than I did.

iXmPnCQGw0RmDX7kvS7kbw.text: First time trying Joe's for Sunday breakfast. Seemed a bit chaotic and unorganized at the register to put your name in.  There were 4 in our party we ordered.  1) #2 Two eggs* with two sausage patties, two bacon strips & a short stack of pancakes - (Eggs cooked well, bacon & sausage patties warm but need to cook bit longer, pancakes tasted good more like a flap jack)  1) Breakfast burrito - Made of three scrambled eggs, chorizo, potatoes, Cheddar cheese & a side of sour cream & salsa - (Lots of flavor and filling)  2) Eggs Benedict - Hollandaise sauce tops two poached eggs on Canadian bacon sitting on crisp english muffins - (Great taste eggs done well, hollandaise nice flavor but needed to be more on the plate, canadian bacon and muffins both needed to be cook/toasted longer)  Over all not bad for a first try. Worth giving it a second shot we all have bad days.

C3dYAt43sM8nLbDuC3ogLg.text: We had very high hopes for the new location. However, things haven't come together just yet. I will give them another chance, in a few weeks to see if things (food) get back to the old ways. I sure hope so!

SrL2fPKyBRY_y04E0YmSBg.text: We have now given Joe's three chances, and three strikes and you're out. My wife and I ordered and the waitress was not very pleasant. I requested poached eggs on top of sourdough toast and received boiled eggs in a bowl and they were so done you could call them hard boiled. My wife ordered her eggs over easy and they to were cooked to death. We were afraid to send them back and get who knows what cooked into our order. Joe came out after our complaint and seemed very put out. We were not charged for the meal but were given a check for $8 for three drinks.

AmZUPSKQAQjcnxJ1XBAxLg.text: So I had an extra early am appt before work and was done quickly. Consequently I was way early for work and wanted to stop and have a sit down breakfast. Of course I turn to yelp since I was in an unfamiliar area. It's hard to find a good old fashioned diner instead of coffee joints these days. The first place I stopped was a coffee joint...*strike* the counter guy was nice but that'll be another review lol. Next I found Joe's Diner. I walked in about 0645 and there were about 4 other diners seated. It smelled slightly musty probably because they just mopped so I can't complain about that. It's nice and clean inside. The smell didn't last at all and wasn't overbearing The server was very friendly.  I received a menu, items are very well priced ($ as posted on yelp) I decided on the corn beef hash because it came with 3 eggs and 1 biscuit and gravy. When the food came I received the eggs and b&g but got a slice of ham instead of the corn beef hash. She was apologetic and took and replaced it. She left the biscuit and gravy so could start with that, which I might say was *awesome!* I asked for the chorizo gravy, and so should you :-) then the eggs and corn beef hash came and I almost passed out out was so good! I only wish I lived closer to this place so I could come here more often!!!

m6JFDVpTFM85Q1PtuZ9YhQ.text: so DISAPPOINTED!!! I was visiting Phoenix from Seattle. I was excited to try Joe's Diner and support a local business. Unfortunately, our waitress got my order incorrect, so I re-ordered. The waitress suggested a subsitution with my original order, which sounded better so I accepted her suggestion. She then brought me the wrong food, AGAIN!! I didn't want to cause a scence, plus I was hungry and my friend had already finished eating.  I tried to eat the item she brought out but I couldn't because it has an ingredient she said it wouldn't come with. Needless to say, I asked for my orignal item. Finally, my "breakfast burrito" arrived... I was happy and about to start eating when  gentleman approached our table. He said to me,  "The next time you come to our resturant , can you please read the menu".  I WAS SHOCKED!!! I couldn't believe one of the employees was saying this to me. I tired to explain there was a miscommunication between myself and the waitress. I was trying to be diplomatic about the situation and did not want to say she got my order wrong TWICE. This person continued to say (all smug and righteous) "please read the menu the next time you come in because I've never had a customer return two meals before". At that point, I asked the gentleman if he was the manager/owner and he said he was. I then told him, I've never experienced something like this before. I then told him I was shocked that we were having this conversation. I told him, his approach was making me feel like I did something wrong. He wasn't listening. He continued to smile and smuggly say "all I ask is that you read the menu" ... he then said "this waitress has worked for me for 16 years and she has never made a mistake". At that point the table next to us said, "She got our order wrong too!"...   I really hope that Joe's Diner reads this and that gentleman thinks about how he approached the situation.   I totally understand if an employer wants to stick up for thier employees (I applaude that) but when the "manager/owner" attacks the customer without understanding the situation, well, I had to post this review.   I hope the Melrose area gets more restaurants in the area... I would love to support them. ...   I'm so sad that this experience has left a nasty taste in my mouth for Joe's Diner.  One last note... not only did I receive the incorrect meal 3 times, I paid the bill for the food my friend ate and the final breakfast burrito.   The waitress seemed scared of this gentleman.  I don't know what was going on with her that morning, that caused the mistakes. I left  her a $2 tip.   I'm not a jerk.. I worked in restaurant business for many years.  As those of us who have worked in that industry know when you are dealing with a "bad" customer AND we know when we are being "bad' customers... no way was I being difficult.   As I'm typing this review up, I'm still shocked with my experience at this diner :(

ojtbY38qFDezdIs5PNRpkg.text: I really really wanted to like this place. Couldn't wait to try it, but sadly, I can wait on returning. The food, was just ok. The service could use some help. Only open from 7am to 3pm, offering breakfast and lunch. One would assume, they have some skills making traditional breakfast fair. We ordered eggs over easy with bacon, and hash browns and some pancakes. The eggs were barely runny, almost lukewarm. The pancakes were just ok. I totally would have sent back the eggs, however our waitress never came back after dropping the food. Never made another appearance, much less to ask how everything was, or to refill our waters. We actually ordered milk, but it was never delivered. It's disappointing when the meal goes bad, and the service isn't there to make up for it. I tried to catch a server, any server to at least get our bill. Ok so, I would understand if the restaurant was busy, and our server was zipping around working her butt off...but no that wasn't the case. I had to get up and walk over to the first employee I saw, and request our bill. By this time, I had almost forgot what she looked like haha. Finally! She makes an appearance to drop off the check. Unfortunately, the bill had the 2 glaases of milk we never received on it. By this time we just wanted to leave our cash on the table, and go.But instead had to make another trip to find the server on the way to the register. At last, I am up at the register getting the bill straightened out....and finally she inquiries about our meal!

yXM2rDeBMBVWo7b0xyxpXA.text: Really? I have been here twice. Never was greeted by anyone. When we sat ourselves we were walked by from the crew without any acknowledgement. When we finally got our food from a very limited breakfast menu, the chicken fried steak was tough. Of course no one asked if things were ok. Now to be fair I will eat just about anything, once.But early in the morning I like a friendly atmosphere and some variety for my breakfast. I will stick with the Melrose Diner up the street.

nCZAXqmav-Y_2bKFabZZlA.text: Sunday 11/24.  Out for a Birthday lunch.  Been to Joes several times at old location, but this was my first time at the new location.  Missed being greeted at the door and having to seat myself.  After sitting for 10 minutes without one person acknowledging the fact that we were there was very disturbing.  Mind you there was 4 waitresses on, only 4 other tables in the place and two of the staff were doing their side work on the booths on each side of us. Sooo after waiting for 10 minutes I finally went up to the front register, I think it was "Joe" who appoligized and promptly came over and took our drink order.  BTW, we still have no menues.  When he came back to the table he did have menues in hand.  Not even 20 seconds later, one of the waitresses who had been doing the sidework around us but failed to acknowledge us came and asked if we were ready to order.  Ugh No, we just got our menues.  Once our order was placed we thought we were in the clear until another waitress came over with a Ice Tea picture full of sugar and sat it on our table while grabbing the sugar dispenser and proceeded to fill it at our table without saying one word to us, then walked away. "AMAZING" not to mention rude.  Of course when the food came everything was wonderful as always.  When we received our Bill, I proceeded to the Restroom while my Friend went to pay the bill.  To my surprise when I came out, he was still standing at the register.  I waited another 5 minutes, so now were talking almost 10 minutes at the register while two staff members are sitting at the counter eating.  I actually called their phone and a waitress came from the back with broom in hand and I told her I'm at the front waiting to pay.  Joe also appeared from a side room and asked the waitress what was wrong, and she told him that we have had a horrible experience since we arrived, "JOE" I presume, groaned and walked away.  The waitress did comp our Beverages without asking because she felt bad, but then to top it all off, she said we should come back when they are bussier, their much better then.  Not sure if I'll give it another try!!

nTxVAWENY3I9lpAfTamaEQ.text: Wow - what a delightful visit!   The chorizo Biscuits and gravy was awesome,  we all really believe that the buttermilk pancakes were sincerely the BEST we have all ever had.    Read that last sentence again!    No kidding.   Cinnamon role was awesome too.   Service outstanding.    Our server Denise was so fun and warm.    Joe himself you could tell was hovering around ensuring that every single client had an outstanding experience.    Daughter really enjoyed chicken sandwich.    Pretty cool to give such a review when they had been in new building for only 3 days and even blowing circuit breakers (they were pretty busy).    FYI - it is on 7th AVENUE not 7th street!

kttI7p0KRyHhRbQgajPCgA.text: I have 3 stars, my family and I went to the previous location several times before they moved.  This was our first time at the new one.  If I didn't know they had only been here a few weeks it would have been a one star review.  For starters Joe assumed my mother in law was my wife, which started things off a bit awkward, but then it took roughly 30 minutes to get our food.  This was attributed to there being 'half power'.  I ordered the chicken fried steak with the cherizo gravy and when it came out, it was undercooked and the breading was mushy, and they didn't put the cherizo gravy on it.  I sent it back and they were quick about replacing but forgot the cherizo gravy again.  I asked for some on the side and it was watery.  Out sever seemed frustrated as well and I had to ask for simple things several times, silverware, water refill, things that should be monitored by a good server. I will come back to Joes, but not for a while, I will give them a chance to get their footing at this new place before going back.

IB74lDOGG2rGYk_mS7195g.text: A coffee joint down the street recommended  this place. And since I love the coffee joint, I thought that this must be good. WRONG! We were right by the door, cashiers area & had the worst service! The food was blah!! I will NOT return.

_XVfQzzy1HnXmIM98DqFRg.text: If a simple but perfect breakfast is what you crave, this is the spot! There's no pork belly on the menu but what there is is great homestyle vittles! The coffee is great and they keep filling it up and never try to rush ya out! I am a regular weekend customer and even during the rush you feel like the only table there. And how often does that happen these days?? You can get a pancake instead of toast!  AWESOME And as a pancake snob I endorse these 100&

64wNAYdJv39EbPnc_SWlAA.text: So yummy! Wait staff are all super friendly. The chicken fried steak was bomb, the gravy was delicious! Definitely try the chorizo biscuits and gravy as well ! For sure my favorite place for breakfast!

tjZbKoormcf9dPqSOah0Hw.text: Joes Diner may have lost a some of the ambience it had at the 16th street location,  they  definitely needed more room.  However, they did not lose any quality in their food. I love, love, love the homemade apple butter.  My eggs are always done perfectly the way I like them and the coffee is really quite good.  My niece loves their pancakes and bacon. This is my go to place for breakfast.  I have tried others but I always come back to Joes.  Give it a try-they are very reasonably priced .

hyUwV74MZZlZEm2Ho_9oCg.text: The croissant breakfast is hands down my favorite. Great coffee and service. Love this place! My wife's favorite is the chorizo burrito.

oS_fUKcMTQZ13YELRRh8Pw.text: First time here, for breakfast.... Was thinking to find something else besides IHOP & Denny's ..... Obviously this place need to call Robert Irvine! Smell old , look old , oily everything you touch .... I have a chance to try anyway because of " good yelp reviews" MISTAKE!!!! Server was sooooo rude, she needs to be "trained" of customer service speak abilities ..... I bet they did not see much nice dressed up people. Ok, food.... Home made potatoes were good, omelet sooooo plain! Do they have at least black pepper? Ok, 1 star for potato....

Bx1hYTnzCVk7s9r4XrAcdg.text: The service was poor we had to ask for refills, and when the server poured it she dripped all over my friends feet then the floor and didn't apologize. My veggie omelet was the only thing hot on my plate, but was dry. The biscuits were so cold and hard the butter didn't even melt. My friends got the biscuits and gravy and his was cold too his 2 eggs over easy were so undercooked that the egg white was still runny and not cooked. Giving them 1 star in hopes that the lunch menu is better than the breakfast. I'm hesitant to even waste time and money to try it.

K7xwaeTzLgJeewPvbAUrhw.text: My friend and I had breakfast here recently. I had pancakes and sausage. He had a Denver omelet. Service was fast and our coffee was regularly topped off. It's the kind of place you feel comfortable hanging out and chatting even after your meal is done. It was good diner fare food in a welcoming environment. There was a little jar of jam on the table and at first I was excited that it might be blackberry (but it wasn't), but it was still good. I felt very welcome and cozy here.

f1Zl6lb7cg2VXnMNfO4VDg.text: Beware of the breakfast burrito and the menu on line.  I ordered a Breakfast Burrito with NO meat and no sour cream for take out.  I asked for extra salsa.  I go to pick up my burrito and it was just an average size burrito with no extra salsa on the side.  I had to ask for the salsa and when I went to pay I was charged over $10.00.  Yes........$10.00.  I asked for a manager who did refund me my money but no discount off the burrito. I left.  Beware!  Chaotic and unorganized for sure!

1ExM0sEnt-eVQUfTD8Q4uQ.text: Finally made it back and thought it was so so. Maybe I should have ordered something else. I had the omelet with ham, cheese, green pepper, and tomatoes and a short stack of pancakes.  It tasted ok, but wasn't really an omelet. the ingredients weren't folded inside, they were mixed in with the eggs. Like scrambled eggs. And then cooked and folded over but it was broken it half.   It came with home fries which tasted ok too but they were 8/10 on the grease factor.  The marbled rye toast was flawless. And the coffee tasted good too, although the waitress took a while to refill. I didn't like the pancakes much. Very thin and the batter was a little chewy inside. But the syrup they have on the table was great. Better than average for artificial.   Overall this place was not horrible but the food wasn't good enough for me to return. I honestly prefer the omelets at Denny's.

Hjki_5xq27Q1CAckeL4iIA.text: It's too bad we weren't able to experience Joes since we'd been there for 10 minutes and no one even said hello to us let alone bother to take our order. never again. They are clearly understaffed.

qCZIcIfA2-kKPpUbHJOnKA.text: I'm kind of bummed about this place. My friend who brought me had nothing but good things to say until now. We walked in and waited 5 minutes to be seated, which is fine.. But then a group comes in after us and gets seated. We get seated and for 20 minutes are ignored by the staff. Finally we decide to leave to another place. I asked to speak with the manager and waited 5 mins before I decide I needed to eat. Sucks too because so many people say the food is great.

UpBmE07-UcC4BWNrGxGtuw.text: Just noticed this place for the first time and stopped in to try it out. My wife and I were both impressed with the food and service. We had the veg omelet, it came out fast and it was great. The bread (toast) is fresh baked and the jam is home made. The owner stopped at our table to see how we liked eveything. We both got a great vibe and great food, we'll be back frequently I'm sure.

toIhTDoZlu46zkMBkiScnQ.text: We live just down the street from Joe's and knew nothing of the old location when we finally saw work being done to the old chinese buffet building. And then one morning it was just open and the place was packed with cars! It seems Joe's has some very loyal regulars. Happy to have a breakfast place within walking distance as the weather has gotten nice, we've been to Joe's a handful of times. Service has always been good, the food has always been decent, and the cars are always lined up every weekend. Welcome to the neighborhood, Joe's!

rpMiO7IWKvUn0gTbRjqVog.text: I really wanted to like this place but......  So disappointing.     Let's start with the decor; dark, mismatched and out dated.  I think they found booths somewhere and shoe horned them into the existing layout left behind by the Chinese restaurant that was the previous tenant.  Really this is as bad as it gets.  I get this is a diner but come on.    The food kinda went with the service; uninviting.  The coffee (and I will drink 7-11 coffee) was just bad.  The potatoes were boiled and then warmed up on the flat top - no crispiness at all.  The chicken fried steak was doughy and under cooked.  Corned beef hash was out of a can and under cooked.   The biscuit was the single shinning moment of the day, first rate.  The service was uninspired but fine.  I didn't expect this place to supplant Matt's but there are a half dozen places within a 5 minute drive that will get my business instead of Joe's.

1EUhaqQc5Gqy4GMnzD_V3w.text: I start my day at Joe's Diner! The rest of the day can be dashing here, zipping there and I never know where or when I get another chance to sit and eat. At least by starting at Joe's I get a chance to fuel up, check a half-dozen online newspapers on my ipad and not run outta steam until later in the day. Sometimes it's not so speedy, but I retired and I don't need speedy, I need tasty and Joe's Diner hits my spot and it takes all of two minutes to get there from mi casa. I will be back, daily!!

etkelKekZpwQulY6P6KK7w.text: Seemingly decent looking place,  we wanted to try given it's proximity to our home....will not return!  Sub par food, mediocre service, not a great value for the buck, and possible the worst restroom on 7th Ave, disgusting!

yedU-1q8VLhOvQakv4Dmtw.text: Don't go to this place. Two of my friends got food poisoning from eating here and both times I've been the food was cold. The other two times I've had their food I picked it up to go and they forgot part of my order or got it wrong completely (even though I had them repeat it back to me). Never eating here again.

6MJhkmogCIJKb6asZjaPzQ.text: What kind of tricks do you have to do to get a drink refill... She drops my food off at my table, grabs my empty beverage glass and disappears.... I took two bites and left... I'm going somewhere i can have a beverage with my breakfast...

gNUsy_2qpaPYMUIfEM9gcQ.text: Joe's Diner is delicious with wonderful people. I love the All-American vibe, and I appreciate the friendly, down-to-earth staff. The only downside for the diner is THEY DON'T SERVE hash browns.

h_V8TONJOfOI6WjTjO2gzw.text: Have been a frequent diner here and just can't do it any longer. I swear if any business was in need of an overhaul of waitstaff and timing it's here.   It always starts with such promise. Time to sit and look at menu and someone brings you a drink. Then you order and the hell begins...  An hour this time (on a Thursday at 10:30) we ordered from the menu no changes. That's when the server disappeared. 38 minutes later she reappeared with two plates of food which she quickly deposited and booked it away.   Want to know why?  Because our food was so cold except the bottom from the heating plate. Butter wouldn't melt on pancakes but it would spread. Ugh really?  Guess what happens then?  Yep 17 minutes of trying to get her to come on by. Finally she does and we get it taken off the bill. Not like we ate any of it. Seriously has this place really given up? Too bad.   Save your time and go anywhere else

kP3tccM4A36ROlRB4Pc1XA.text: Love coming here on the weekend, although the wait can be a lil excessive. It's worth it! The food is always fresh and hot. So you know it was just made. Joe is always there to greet and make sure things are running smoothly. When you're in the neighborhood (Melrose) check this place out.

CvcflhBg_YhexU8W1nh2SQ.text: Yummy cinnamon rolls! Good home cooking. Got the breakfast bowl with some spinach that hit he spot and tasted very good.

cKVBSP2ZvBlFSbVzvrEOiA.text: Amazing little diner!! Will definitely be back!!! Very friendly and accommodating. The owner I believe even came by our table to check on our food and see how everything was. LOVE LOVE this place. First time here and will come back again!

ibBFKcd1APbRZQ-svGwt0Q.text: I wish I could rave about Joe's, but it was just so-so. Of course, there's not much you can do to basic eggs and fried potatoes. My friend had the biscuits and gravy and it was just average. I think if you're looking for a decent breakfast, you probably can't go wrong here. They have a selection of jams and jellies to go with your breakfast, which is a nice touch! Service was pleasant and we didn't have to wait long for our meal. All in all, a safe bet for a basic breakfast when you're in the area.

CjyyGALc6vNOs40EEK5zxQ.text: Simple but real good. Fast service and great food. I got the breakfast burrito and it was bomb! Nowhere near where we live but a great stop

yaq72XDQiqWS1y1Kn84uhQ.text: So we've been here a couple time now and I have to say they really do have the best pancakes. I'm also partial to the hash and the biscuits. The only thing I haven't liked so far was the chorizo gravy, it had kind of chipotle smokiness to it that I wasn't a fan of, but seriously it hasn't stopped me from coming back because they're regular gravy is lights out.  If your in the area you can't go wrong with brekfast at Joe's!

rLFWrnRZmpoeISX0eWUiJA.text: Just okay. The pancakes were very tasty, but the breakfast special burrito had no flavor. Strangely, the coffee was pretty flavorless too. Service was quick and faultless; just a bit miffed at the blandness. Maybe we'll try again in a month or so.

NZBlL57qi9iojcqsyk3OnA.text: This place is ON-POINT! Went with a good friend for the first time this morning. Had the 2 egg special and he had a vegetarian omelet. We both had coffees and water. The service and food were excellent! The owner even makes their own jam (today was cherry)! I can't find anything to complain about here and 2 meals with drinks and 20% tip was $34.60 out-the-door. I will DEFINITELY be brining my wife back for her to try this gem!

photos.caption: Photo of Joe's Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. $9.99 breakfast special...YUM!

gA9m9Ot58_IDY_M2QCUlkw.text: We come here all the time on Sunday and today horrible. Took 49 minutes to get our food & then the poached eggs were hard boiled. Now we are waiting for the kitchen to make the whole meal again. The coffee in our mugs are cold!   The waitress was gracious and apologized. She also comped our meals. The pancake was burnt & looked gross so it was not eaten. My waffle was good. I never received my biscuits & gravy. My husband received a burnt, cold, rubbery pancake.   So disappointed as the service & food are usually consistent and good.   It is quite obvious that Joe is not here today.

photos.caption: Photo of Joe's Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Burnt pancake

KNf8MBz0U4c7fMIEFWaUJQ.text: Best pancakes (or are they flapjacks?  IDK) in the 602.  Seriously, good.  We've only ever been there for breakfast, which is always top-notch.  We've been going since they moved from 16th St years ago.  Dozens of times, literally.  Between the price, quality and service, I think it deserves all 5 stars.

69VEyyHht9HhCBi5fvJ9PQ.text: Cozy little diner with fast service. Twice Deb has taken my order and it was perfect and reasonably priced. I have only tried the breakfast so far.  The great: panckes! Not like ihop; the real kind that are thin and griddle-yummy. Biscuits and gravy; apparently I was wrong about hating chorizo because the gravy is about as good as you'll get in phoenix. The only better is the cream gravy at Texaz on the chicken fried steak. The breakfast potato cubes are delicious and well seasoned.  The good: corned beef hash could have been a bit crispier. The eggs I requested very softly scrambled could have been a bit runnier; it seems they were just scrambled as usual. The chicken fried steak was okay, but clearly came from a bag of frozen steaks. Even the delicious gravy it was smothered in could not mask this observation. At the $10.99 price, i expect more from a diner. f you want a genuine chicken fried steak, wait until Texaz Grill opens and get a monster real one for less. I am from Texas soiknow what I'm talking about here.  The bad: the sausage patties. I hate to dis a sausage anything, but the patty was cold and 'gamey'. Go for extra bacon if you can. Bacon was a bit cold and hard, but still better than the sausage.  Overall, I like their food and will return to try the Monte Cristo which sounds fantastic.

eVBWBRa45ojZQ12QnBBHJg.text: 4 1/2 stars!  Chicken fried steak was very good, eggs were fresh, pancakes to die for, and coffee tasty!  Not too busy. Friendly staff and good service.    First time here & I'll be back!

5rO6XTFwYaucIYjEY_XONw.text: Best pancakes in Phoenix. Or as the Fonz aka Henry Winkler calls them "pancakes from Heaven."  Joe's Diner is the local watering hole. The breakfast water cooler of sorts. Where you go to find out the latest news about your town. Or enjoy a morning with friends, chatting over a cup of coffee.  It's not the typical place you'd expect an Emmy Award-winning actor to seek out. Nor a tourist. But that's where I found myself shortly after arriving in Phoenix. Sitting in a booth near the jukebox, listening to the conversations around me, and enjoying a simple breakfast.  When I choose to eat at Joe's Diner, I didn't know that the owner, Joe Seriale was a classically trained chef. Nor that he had cooked at the Fairmont San Francisco and the Boulders Resort & Spa.  Unlike a modern hipster diner trying to be retro, Joe's Diner is the real thing. A Rowe AMI jukebox machine sits against one wall silent, unplayed. Possibly forgotten. A reminder of what once was and is no longer.  It's a seat yourself type of establishment. Choose from a red or green vinyl booth or a nondescript table with stacking chairs, the type you'd see at church or school.  Laminated faux woodgrain tabletops featuring business cards and ads from local businesses. Old gas station signs and photos reminiscent of a day long ago.  It's quiet. There's no music or TV. You can have a conversation and hear the conversations of others.  One waitress running the restaurant, taking orders and busing tables. The way it used to be before big corporations and their franchises rolled in.  Regulars sit in the same booth every day. Men talking about golf, AA meetings, and Bible study. Where it's not uncommon for heated argument between family members. Mother against daughter. They leave for a few minutes and then come back, order their food and enjoy their breakfast in a state of detente. Cold stares across the table. Soundless except for the clattering of silverware against plates.  The food at Joe's Diner is homemade from scratch. Scratch meaning starting from nothing. You won't find a bag of Krusteaz's or Bisquick pancake mix in the kitchen.  Jams, jellies, biscuits, gravy, croissants, pastries, and of course, their pancakes are made at Joe's Diner. Fun tip: They sell 3,000 pancakes a month. Twice a day they make pancake batter and three times on Sundays.  They make every effort to source and use local ingredients. Their flour, coffee, cream, honey, and chorizo are all produced in Arizona.  Despite being a diner, prices were high. Higher than I had expected. This was Phoenix, not San Diego. An $11 meat and cheese omelet? A $10 breakfast burrito? Visions of saving money no longer danced in my head.  The best value items are the:  Pancakes - $4.79 for a short stack or $5.79 for a three stack Waffles - $5.99 topped with strawberries and whipped cream French Toast - $5.99 Biscuits and Gravy - $4.49  Waffles are my go to. But today I wasn't in the mood for carbs. I wanted protein. Something light and not too heavy to tide me over for the two-hour drive to Sedona.  Eggs.  The two eggs special comes with seasoned homemade potatoes and choice of toast or biscuit for $7.99. Tip: Order the two egg special separately a la carte from the sides menu and save $0.22. But my hips didn't need the potatoes so I ordered an egg and toast for $3.98, not including tax.  My over-medium egg was over easy. But the toast. Oh, the toast.  I love a good hearty piece of bread, especially wheat or a multi-grain bread. Gluten all the way baby! The thick slices of bread were almost twice the size of a standard slice. The only bummer. It came pre-buttered, perhaps margarine or ghee.  But I'd order it again, specifying to leave off butter. And send back the over easy egg.

qE-Fte_6bDhcA1Vj0X6Apw.text: We were in town for a few days looking for a breakfast place. Great food, great service. We wanted hash from a can and not homemade and this is the place! Food was tasty! Didn't wait long for service. Recommend this place!

The place is a bit dated and the silverware is bent but it's comfortable. It's much bigger on the inside than it appears and there are plenty of booths and large tables if you are going with a group. I love breakfast food morning, noon and night but for some reason I passed over that large portion of the menu and ordered a sandwich. I had the Rachel which was turkey, coleslaw and thousand island on marbled rye. It came with a side of crispy fries. The sandwich was just ok. The coleslaw on it seemed a bit off so I scraped most of it off. My friend had the hot roast beef sandwich which came smothered in gravy with mashed potatoes. We also shared a slice of hot apple pie.

Biscuits and gravy (regular or chorizo) is always a favorite. While corn beef hash has never been a favorite of mine. I find myself ordering this here frequently. I can't say enough about the food, and then you get the mom and pop service from employees who not only seem to care, but actually want to be friendly. You can typically spot Joe rolling up his sleeves and busing tables right along with the rest of the staff. You're welcome, trust me, you'll thank me.

QeEGV_TsTsBGA0kJNdg-Iw.text: Used to be my favorite. No longer. 7:30 on a Sunday with one guy in the diner. We are yelled from the back to sit by two girls and served iced cold potatoes, sausage, hash, and eggs. Ew gross. No thanks. We won't be back. When Joe is there everything is always awesome!

cu73Hdmtt8-KCjuE_qALhw.text: I saw this place on Yelp and thought we'd give it a try. The waitress was less than friendly.  We both ordered pancakes and eggs. The food came out promptly, but our eggs were cold and our pancakes were almost burnt. They were so crispy on the outside that we even decided to send them back. When we asked the waitress to take the pancakes back because they were too overcooked, she said she would see if the cook would take them back. When she came back to our table she told us that the cook stated that she could not cook them any differently than they were presented to us. She asked if we'd like to keep the pancakes!  Unbelievable! So we had to either accept the pancakes or order something else. I ordered the cinnamon roll and it was okay. Overall we were not satisfied with the service and the food was not tasty or hot or cooked the way we would have liked it to be cooked.  I do not recommend this place for breakfast.

fT2pmT175wl8RCwZi83HCg.text: Great place to get a classic delicious breakfast. Always have a good time here. Awesome coffee. Can never go wrong with the pancakes and I'm not even a pancakes kind of person.  Worth it

B3smFfVA3QWU39S_Nanuwg.text: Delicious breakfast. Steak and Eggs, biscuits and gravy, and eggs benedict were all great.

tmBkc5PZNTVeL-trpcy3-A.text: The best pancakes I've ever had ... the cinnamon rolls are pretty killer to ...

photos.caption: Photo of Joe's Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States

oe85JMFSmHZ9zpM4ElnH_A.text: Sorry to say, if you been to one diner you have been to them all. The food is ok, nothing to write home about and I like to judge my diner food off one entree, biscuits an gravy. Joe's has 2 different types, a sweet sausage and chorizo; I had the sweet sausage and yeah I'm not impressed. I had a burger, I'd like to def try their omelets next time we go. Awesome frys and customer service!!

ugr6mfP96OAaBxEM9owt3g.text: Very good food and service! Never disappointed when eating at Joe's! The servers are quick with a smile and always makes sure we are taken care of. The food is typical diner food, just what you would expect from a diner, pricing seems to be right in line with most other Phoenix diners and your coffee is always filled up!

lisONgQWGIYghsuuVV5PcQ.text: BEST PANCAKES ANYWHERE! Ill take their pancakes over IHOP, Dennys, Cracker Barrell, anyplace. Family owned, the owners Joe and Joann are amazing. Very family friendly, good people, and recognize all their regulars. They are always working, and are committed to their diner. Great portions of food, and again....THE PANCAKES. Give it a try if you're in uptown PHX one of these days.

eZlCwVoq6rYD0sVU44WT6Q.text: This has become one of our favorite breakfast spots. The staff is always nice, the food is yummy, and the portions are huge. We have never had to wait to be seated, or very long for our food. It's definitely classic diner breakfast, but it's not too greasy. The coffee is good too!

UxXvZc-Yzv4dlYIp3ufGEw.text: Dolores G and I came here for breakfast before walking the Melrose shops. Upon walking in, I was struck by how outdated this new location looked. I was expecting more of what their last location looked like. After reading some of the yelp tips, I decided on their pancakes. I ordered the short stack (2 pancakes), added 2 eggs, and a side of corn beef hash. Total was $8.50. Very inexpensive. The food was tasty and I was in a food coma after finishing my pancakes. Typical breakfast fare.   Service was okay. At first the server was very attentive and then we hadn't seen her for like 15 minutes. Our empty plates were stacked at the edge of the table and we waited awhile while waiting for our checks. Finally I went up to the front and asked if we paid up front. She said we could pay but I still wasn't clear if we were supposed to or not.   I think this is a good addition to the Melrose strip. I don't know that I would come back over other breakfast places in the area but I think this is heads and tails over Melrose Kitchen (around the corner) for value and quality of the food.

RJo7HH6_l9A-XfudXeT8-g.text: Love the belgium waffle! Owners are very friendly. My girlfriend and I come here a lot because of location to our house, and it's an easy, no fuss place to grab a bite.

IQNxPerxzGOjgQiSmbNEMw.text: Great food and great service. I miss their old location but the new location has more room. It's great to see Joe and Joe working and talking to all the customers

photos.caption: Photo of Joe's Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Short stacks!

FOVEHS1abdI9N8Q0GA3Eyg.text: When I first went here at the old location it's was definitely 5 stars. Now that it has moved its different now, don't know why. Just some constructive criticism....the pancakes needs to be cooked on a griddle only for pancakes. They tasted like burnt oil with griddle burnt specs and pieces on them. They used to have a vanilla or maple flavor don't know what has changed. Also the chorizo biscuits had a sour taste to them don't know if that is a part of the recipe? They are always fast and friendly here so great fast breakfast on my day off. :) Enjoyed my alone time there today.

RSNHAGrLtzd2XG807tCTdA.text: Joe's has been our go to place for breakfast since they open,always good food & great service.

Dpjsq3Qvd-nGrC-Ido_3cg.text: When you want a solid, good old-fashioned diner breakfast, this is the place to come. The food is pretty standard (although the waffles and strawberries were a standout!!), but when it comes to a diner breakfast, that's exactly what I want. Solid favorites and an endless cup of coffee.  My only complaint is that I wish they had a diaper changing station in the bathroom (new mom trying to figure out restaurant eating with a little one)! But certainly not a deal breaker for me, I'll be back for sure.

tZWlQo-TxXCOhGTjWMnpGg.text: Busy on a Sunday morning, but totally worth the wait. Food was fantastic. Highly recommend the corned beef hash and the pancakes. Denver omelette with potatoes was a winner too. Lots of food, but we totally cleaned our plates because we couldn't stop eating!

22AumFVJL8858I7tazWXMw.text: Tried Joes today for the first time, even tho we've lived less than a mile away for almost 2 yrs. We are so sad we waited this long to find this jewel! Sunday mid morning and only waited about 5 min. Everyone was friendly and attentive. Delicious from scratch biscuits! And the pancakes.... Ooohhhh the pancakes!! *pause to wipe away drool* BEST pancakes ever!!! We will definitely be back!!

j7jsOueX3d3eK9bhytuy1Q.text: After reading the menu we ordered one order of pancakes, one chorizo omelet, and one eggs benedict with biscuits and gravy all with coffee.  The coffee was delicious, fresh and hot.  The pancakes were really fluffy and tasty especially with the home made apple butter and jam.  The chorizo omelet was the best I have ever had and the biscuits were amazing!  Just the right side were the very delicious potatoes.  The benedict was a bit disappointing since it was canned hash but the biscuits and gravy made up for it.  Will we go back? Absolutely!!

q7KsnOWQpDcZHaa4ZYfrjA.text: Can you say homemade Hollandaise sauce? Central Phoenix has some really really good breakfast spots but Joe's Diner is the best of all of them. I'm an early riser so I've never had to wait but often when we're leaving there is a small line. Then only is the food good the staff is excellent and the place is spotless. Definitely worth all 5 stars

vnIIOjYf96CK2fnRgNHpHQ.text: Was in Phoenix this morning on business .Looked at yelp reviews and this place had favorable ones. Was seated promptly, and the waitress was very pleasant and prompt Bathroom was very clean, so enough of the pluses. Had ham and eggs, don't know why they call the potatoes spicy because along with the rest of my breakfast was tasteless. The water could use another run thru a filter, I did leave full but like most breakfast spots in phoenix I just kept thinking what a waste of money. I don't understand why for 11 dollars you don't get a real piece of ham instead of the spam like formed piece I received. They do offer a ham steak but its in the please don't substitute section. Just a total disappointment, I don't understand why you cant offer a fresh and favorable breakfast without charging 20 dollars

VL6T4eQfaZ38-GaPJa2l9Q.text: What a great experience. The food was amazing, especially the biscuits and gravy. Coffee is fresh and tasty. The best part is the owners Joe and his wife. Joe came to the table and spoke of the local ingredienta he uses to prepare his yummy food. This is great place!

9ujSQvZwvTQLhrJxlSM-Rg.text: This used to be our go-to Saturday morning breakfast joint.  We were regular diners almost every Saturday for over a year. The food was good and the service was fast. The service was not always the friendliest but that just depended upon who served you.  There was one particular server that was always quite unfriendly (we later discovered that this unfriendly server was one of the owners - Joe's wife) but everyone else was friendly and efficient.  One Saturday morning it all changed.  My husband ordered his usual sausage and eggs, eggs over-medium.  When the server asked how our meal was he was honest and said that it wasn't as good as it usually was.  The eggs were a little under-cooked.  The server told one of the owners (Joe's wife) that we were unhappy with our food and my husband repeated that it was okay but the eggs just were a little under-cooked and that it was unusual for us to have food we didn't like (since we had been eating there almost every Saturday for over a year).  The owner's response was atrocious!  She said the eggs are cooked exactly the way they are supposed to be and suggested that we should read the menu so we know how to order correctly.  My husband patiently explained to her that he always orders his eggs the same way and usually the food tastes great so he thought maybe there was a new cook. She didn't want to hear any of it.  She never even apologized!  She was extremely rude and maintained that he just didn't know how to order his food correctly.  I couldn't believe she was so rude to customers, especially regular ones. But she is so oblivious that she didn't even recognize that we had set foot in her restaurant before.  We will NEVER eat here again. We refuse to support a business with such rude ownership.

sVBNUbQprj97u6QxMnf8fA.text: Came in on father's day and only had to wait about 10 minutes which I thought was pretty great for being so busy. The wait staff was working really hard and was jumping from table to table getting orders and drinks. It was pretty understandable that they took our order quickly and didn't spend too much time at our table.   I ordered the chorizo omelette. It took about 20 minutes to get out to me. I think it could have come out a little faster since it was just lukewarm when it got to me. But it was still delicious! The eggs were fresh and the cheese was melty. I really like the potatoes it comes with as well. They know how to season a potato!   So I would give this place a solid 9/10! They also serve RC cola which is super rad! I will be back for sure!

4HxEKmZlEP0Xc6H5TYGIgg.text: Nice breakfast menu with the normal staples. The Chorizo biscuits and gravy were spicy and rich with moist house made biscuits... the French toast was below average and plain. The coffee and service were great.

TdXF08JQ0MOJwkWBWnMbvg.text: I work in the local area and we wanted a quality breakfast, but on the go. We ordered take out and they had everything ready in 10 minutes of the call. It was really good and filling.   The side order of bacon is legit. It's not that bacon you buy when you are on a budget, that's for sure ;) The chorizo gravy was amazing, with a little spicy kick to it- it's worth the upgrade. Had I know these guys were here, I'd have been coming here more often

photos.caption: Photo of Joe's Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. French toast, with a side of bacon

k50hwP_BoQiBr277CkjZ0A.text: I came here for the first time earlier this week and I love the very quiet, humble environment.  I had the corn beef hash-- delicious!!  I can't wait to come back again soon.  They also serve the best coffee!! The staff are very friendly too.

C0Pgd0NcXbKxPnwlEMLtMA.text: Joe's Diner is awesome from beginning to end! The wait staff is on top of their game and takes good care of their guests! This is only my second time here but after Joe introduced himself to the whole family and took the time to tell us about how everything, even the napkins are sourced here in Arizona! The idea of this place started around the campfire and you can still taste it in the food! Thank you Joe your place is definitely special!

photos.caption: Photo of Joe's Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States

ddTMCZRvT8CxkeRpyjUHwQ.text: If the monte cristo was deep fried and dusted with some powdered sugar, this would be the closest to a "good traditional / boardering on excellent" monte cristo you could get in the valley.  My wife's waffles were delicious.  We ordered through Postmates.  We will give another go in a week or so.

BeCKqekKCMmkx8vomSjnMg.text: Perfect!  Great breakfast! No complaints!  Pretty busy morning, but the staff kept us full and happy! I enjoyed my corn beef and hash with eggs...something you don't find on the menu at all restaurants. The only complaint I had was the d-bag behind me...who complained about everything in his life. Having D-bags for customers is no fault of the restaurant so no dedctuctions of points there.

photos.caption: Photo of Joe's Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Corn beef hash and biscuits and gravy
Photo of Joe's Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chicken fried steak. The.potatoes were perfect

fcOFdMePpOxaRcCcLp_3-w.text: I had been here once about a year ago when I first moved to the neighborhood but never reviewed them. I went back again on Thursday for breakfast. The staff was super friendly, I believe the owners were actually waiting tables and both were great. Its a sort of greasy spoon. The only meat they have is pork no turkey bacon or chicken sausage or even beef so if your not a pork eater you will not be eating meat here. I ordered a combo it had pancakes , eggs and potatoes. The pancakes were really good probably the best thing I ordered. The potatoes were seasoned well but not hot and the eggs were okay. Its not fancy at all but absolutely serves its purpose for breakfast and good service always helps. Our bill was $28 which isn't bad but also kinda high for a greasy spoon. I probably won't go here regularly but when I feel like good pancakes close to home I would definitely think of Joes.

ePZRt5OLswUnOcOdCvEXDw.text: If you want house made , high quality locally sourced ingredients in a coffee shop without the snooty prices come to Joe's Diner on 7th Ave. for breakfast and lunch.   You will definitely meet the owners Joe and Deb who are gracious and charming.     But back to the food:   The best pancakes and buttermilk biscuits EVER.   Omelets and eggs made perfectly .   House made jams and good strong coffee roasted from Tucson.   Fantastic sandwiches and salads all fresh and tasting of thoughtful and expert preparation.    Wonderful coffee shop!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Joe's Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Combo omelet / homemade buttermilk biscuit and home fries
Photo of Joe's Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Border eggwhites omelet with homemade buttermilk biscuit and home fries
Photo of Joe's Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Joe&#39;s Diner :  border eggwhite omelet with ham, cheese, green chile, a side of home fries, in house made biscuit and salsa!

_ajtOHnZAIO7VL-es4wrPQ.text: I believe I already left a review for Joes, but if I didn't then here it goes. The owners here are super nice humble friendly professional business owners. I love their pancakes. They are literally the best pancakes I have had, and they are for sure homemade no boxed pancakes here. The food is consistently good. The servers here are prompt. Even if you order takeout the quality does not suffer. Joes is always a good idea. I have never been disappointed in all my years of coming here. It is always money well spent. Every time! Eat at Joes!

-Cu-NBmff0jmLqrmrfDTAA.text: I'd enjoyed Joe's Diner in its old location and was feeling good about checking it out in its newer, more convenient spot. Huge portions, good food, good service, what's not to like?  After I'd waited a while at the "please wait to be seated" sign, a server called out that she'd get to me in a minute, then went off to take the order of a large table. Okay, maybe they'd been waiting a while, and if you don't get that in to the kitchen, things bog down. Then another server came over and asked which of us in the foyer was first. "Me," I said. The father with two kids behind me said: "She is."  The server then looked right past me, picked up three menus, and went to seat the party behind me, the same party that was clearly puzzled and embarrassed to be seated first when they'd said it was my turn.  My strong suspicion, since I'm very tall and had gone for retro-glam in high-heeled mules and a large hat, was that the staff jumped to the erroneous conclusion that I was either a drag queen or transgender. That's an excellent reason for me to not spend money there: I live in a queer-friendly neighborhood because I like those values (whether I need them to apply to me or not) and there are plenty of places I'm more comfortable supporting.

M4VQVhWwQPiaU_0Wy7gpxg.text: Real Men Don't Eat Quiche.(1)  So fine, I'll just turn in my man card for a month.  Only served on Saturdays and the ingredients change according to availability.  This generous portion of quiche in bacon spinach form was enjoyed by 3 of the 6 people at our table.  It came with a bowl of diced melons.  Not to say it is the only good thing to eat here as everything ordered at the table disappeared quickly from our plates.  Including a shared stack of pancakes of which I had one.  But the quiche alone is enough reason to get there on a Saturday.  This was my first time at the new digs.  The small parking lot is saved by having street parking along the canal.  There are more tables here but on this Saturday late morning there was never more than a couple of empty tables at any given time.  With the layout large groups have to be broken up.  Service was spot on.  And the owner was visible in the dining room most of the time helping out where needed.  (1)Feirstein 1982)

VFpBm0MInY2QO1z1P1Y6mw.text: Don't underestimate this place by it's looks. This colorful restaurant is all heart by a couple who wanted good local food. The biscuits are so light and fluffy......like a dream. You MUST eat at least two: one with butter and local honey and one with butter and owners freshly made cherry preserves. The pancakes are the BEST in the valley; (yes, even better than Matt's & Butter). So run, don't walk and Enjoy!

A2WWTVnV6PdyUyrdagC_0w.text: Well we decided to try this place since it's close to home.. The menu is your standard diner food but I was pleasantly surprised to see the Monte cristo sandwich (haven't had one in years).. We were greeted and seated promptly by a friendly girl of about 17. Our waitress arrived quickly and took our drink order then brought our drinks and took our food order. The food arrived quickly and the waitress(Alina according to the receipt) brought our ranch dressing and strawberry jam we requested. Unfortunately that was the last we saw of her. Another waitress asked if my daughter wanted more ice tea. We ended up having to ask another waitress for our check. Right before we stood up to leave someone finally asked if I'd like more coffee.  It was a little to late.. The food was okay but way over priced for what you get. I've attached the bill.

photos.caption: Photo of Joe's Diner - Phoenix, AZ, United States. A bit more than I&#39;d normally pay.. I can think of several other places with better food, prices and service.

IodZUpV9uU_BlfppmPdGEg.text: Absolutely fantastic! The food and service was great. Friendly atmosphere and the owners are just awesome and sociable. The biscuits and gravy, French toast, corn beef hash, and sandwiches are yummy.  We were passing through from Texas to California - the biscuits and gravy meets every southern expectation. Highly recommended!

sbbMpQCcXkPE2y_FtrYILg.text: Disgusting sums it all up. I was looking for a  place to have lunch that was not fast food. I gave this place a try and regretted it. Ordered the meatloaf and it was barely warm and the gravy was cold and like jello! Two little thinly slices of meatloaf and nasty mash potatoes. I picked at it for a few minutes and pushed the plate away not even attempting to try the vegetables. The check was given to me before I even took my first bite.   $12 for this garbage? No way Jose this place sucks!

tRRb2p9Ue7sIz1Lu4JGZYQ.text: A Master Chef and food historian brought me to Joe's Diner. I've been coming back ever since. The decor is classic American diner but the food and coffee is a cut above. $10 sandwiches are done perfectly. The coffee is Arbuckles Ariosa cowboy coffee. The waitress was very nice. Nice little mid town jem in the Melrose District

3IXTAYL0CitJ2T-WGZKQSQ.text: Owned by a gal that I went to HighSchool with North High. Met up with three other people from school for breakfast. My first time here the food was very good egg cooked perfect chorizo gravy over biscuits yum yum it was very good

EepfB4TTRtsfh243CvYRlA.text: The Hostess  seated me with out even saying hello. The service was cold the waitress didn't  deliver the food I think it was a cook the food was over priced and the chicken fried steak was not crispy it was a disappointment.

rwOE7uyLSJYeZ02kRjCXuw.text: Man let me tell y'all something! I went here for the first time ever this morning and MY MY MY! This food here! This food right here! The cook has to be touched by God! The steak was so tender man cut through it like butter! The biscuits and gravy look don't get me started! The eggs were on point and the potatoes! YES GAWD! Man I'll be back that's for sure! Even the 7UP tasted like it came from a holy tap!
